post_text:
#CSDFirstDay returns!

Download and print a CSD First Day sign for your first day of school photos! Then share them on social media using the hashtag #CSDFirstDay

You can find signs for 2020 at this link: https://www.central.k12.or.us/cms/One.aspx?portalId=7539220&pageId=47011082
No sign? No Problem!! The smiling faces are what we want to see anyway!

When you post to your social networks, be sure to use #CSDFirstDay and make your posts public so we can see them.

You can also send them to us via Facebook Messenger or email them to info@central.k12.or.us.

We can‚Äôt wait to see you all! #distancelearning2020 #Distancedoesnotstopus #WeAreCentral

post_text:
Central School District Families, Staff and Community,

Let me begin by saying thank you to our students, families, staff, and community for your continued flexibility as we work through these unique times. As shared this morning, school buildings were closed today because of the ash and smoke in the air. We are continuing to monitor the air, smoke and ash to assess if we can turn our HVAC systems back on.

Virtual orientation meetings scheduled for Friday will continue as planned. Because of the situation with the fires, smoke, and ash we haven't been able to have orientations with families who do not have internet access and/or reliable internet access. We know it is important to build relationships between our students, families and staff, as we continue to partner together for the 2020-21 school year. We will use Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday to complete orientations and push the official first day of school to Thursday, September 17th. If you had in-person orientations scheduled, look for communication from your teacher to reschedule.

Families that have let us know they have no internet, we are continuing to build and working to get access to your homes. More information will continue to be shared as we head into next week.

We are working on rescheduling the Chromebook checkouts and will update you as soon as we know the details.

Meals will be served as normal 10 a.m. to noon at our buildings, and those who were signed up for weekly pickup at Talmadge Middle School for today (Thursday) can pick up tomorrow (Friday). We also will have our bus pickup locations available.

What I have learned and continue to learn is that our students, staff and community continue to be resilient and adapt in these unprecedented times. Please continue to partner with us, give yourself, each other and us grace as we are CSD 13J strong! We will continue to get through this and begin school in a positive and successful way!

Please continue to watch your emails, voicemails and the district Facebook page for more updates. Email info@central.k12.or.us with any concerns or questions. Or please call 503-606-2251.
Thank you

Familias, personal y comunidad del Distrito Escolar Central,

Perm√≠tanme comenzar agradeciendo a nuestros estudiantes, familias, personal y comunidad por su continua flexibilidad mientras trabajamos en estos tiempos √∫nicos. Como se comparti√≥ esta ma√±ana, los edificios escolares fueron cerrados hoy debido a la ceniza y el humo en el aire. Continuamos monitoreando el aire, el humo y las cenizas para evaluar si podemos volver a encender nuestros sistemas de ventilaci√≥n.

Las reuniones de orientaci√≥n virtual programadas para el viernes continuar√°n seg√∫n lo planeado. Debido a la situaci√≥n de los incendios, el humo y las cenizas, no hemos podido tener orientaciones con familias que no tienen acceso a internet y / o acceso confiable a internet. Sabemos que es importante construir relaciones entre nuestros estudiantes, familias y personal, mientras seguimos colaborando juntos para el a√±o escolar 2020-21. El lunes, martes y mi√©rcoles usaremos para completar las orientaciones y adelantar el primer d√≠a oficial de clases al jueves 17 de septiembre. Si ten√≠as programadas orientaciones en persona, busca la comunicaci√≥n de tu maestro para reprogramar.

Familias que nos han hecho saber que no tienen Internet, continuamos construyendo y trabajando para tener acceso a sus hogares. Se seguir√° compartiendo m√°s informaci√≥n a medida que avancemos la pr√≥xima semana.

Estamos trabajando para reprogramar los prestados de Chromebook y lo actualizaremos tan pronto que sepamos los detalles.

Las comidas se servir√°n normalmente de 10 a.m. a mediod√≠a en nuestros edificios, y los que se inscribieron para la recogida semanal en la escuela secundaria Talmadge para hoy (jueves) pueden recoger ma√±ana (viernes). Tambi√©n tendremos nuestros lugares de recogida de autob√∫s disponibles.

Lo que he aprendido y sigo aprendiendo es que nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidad contin√∫an siendo resilientes y adapt√°ndose en estos tiempos sin precedentes. Por favor, contin√∫en asoci√°ndose con nosotros, denles gracia a ustedes mismos, a los dem√°s y a nosotros, ¬°ya que somos fuertes en CSD 13J! ¬°Continuaremos superando esto y comenzaremos la escuela de una manera positiva y exitosa!

Contin√∫e revisando sus correos electr√≥nicos, mensajes de voz y la p√°gina de Facebook del distrito para obtener m√°s actualizaciones. Env√≠e un correo electr√≥nico a info@central.k12.or.us con cualquier inquietud o pregunta. O llame al 503-606-2251.

post_text:
Good morning Central School District Families,

School buildings are closed today because of the ash and smoke in the air. It has taken its toll on our HVAC systems, and we need to turn them off.
All orientations that have been scheduled virtually will continue as planned. Orientations scheduled in person will be rescheduled.
No meals will be served today at the buildings or at the bus stops, unfortunately.
We will assess the situation for tomorrow and hope to get an update out this afternoon or early evening.
Please watch your emails, voicemails and the district Facebook page for more updates.
Email info@central.k12.or.us with any concerns or questions.

Thank you

Buenos d√≠as familias del Distrito Escolar Central,

Todos las escuelas y edificios del Distrito est√°n cerradas hoy debido a las cenizas y humo en el aire. Nuestro sistema de ventilaci√≥n se ha visto afectado y es necesario que lo apaguemos.
Todas las orientaciones por videollamada que est√°n planeadas para hoy continuar√°n seg√∫n lo planeado. Las conferencias programadas en persona ser√°n reprogramadas. Desafortunadamente no se servir√°n desayunos y almuerzos en las escuelas o paradas de autobuses hoy. Evaluaremos la situaci√≥n para ma√±ana y esperemos tener una actualizaci√≥n esta tarde.
Por favor est√© al pendiente de su correo electr√≥nico, mensajes de voz y la p√°gina de facebook del Distrito para m√°s actualizaciones.
Favor de mandar un correo electr√≥nico a info@central.k12.or.us si tiene alguna pregunta o preocupaci√≥n.

Gracias

post_text:
Sports practices are starting up!! We are taking great care in creating a safe environment for sports practices to be able to continue.

If you are interested in participating, and would like to practice, make sure you are registered for SEASON 1. Registration is done through the Parent Portal of PowerSchool. Season 1 will officially begin on Monday and end December 27th. All sports will have the opportunity to practice during this time. We are focusing on "spring sports" a bit starting on Monday. If you are interested in GOLF, BASEBALL, SOFTBALL, TENNIS, or TRACK, make sure you reach out to Mrs. Wallace in the athletic office to see what you need to do to get registered and to make sure your sports physical is up to date! "Fall sports" will be practicing off and on as well, but the "priority time" will start October 12th, and winter sports will follow that. We may see some open gyms in there though, so don't delay in getting registered for SEASON 1.

If you are NOT interested in any sports, please disregard this email.

¬°Las pr√°cticas de deportes arrancan! Estamos teniendo mucho cuidado en la creaci√≥n de un ambiente seguro para que las pr√°cticas deportivas puedan continuar.

Si est√° interesado en participar y desea practicar, aseg√∫rese de estar registrado para la TEMPORADA 1. El registro se realiza a trav√©s del Portal para Padres de PowerSchool. La temporada 1 comenzar√° oficialmente el lunes y finalizar√° el 27 de diciembre. Todos los deportes tendr√°n la oportunidad de practicar durante este tiempo. Nos estamos centrando en los "deportes de primavera" un poco a partir del lunes. Si usted est√° interesado en GOLF, BASEBALL, SOFTBALL, TENNIS, o TRACK, aseg√∫rese de comunicarse con la se√±ora Wallace en la oficina de atletismo para ver lo que necesita hacer para registrarse y para asegurarse de que su f√≠sico deportivo est√° al d√≠a! "Deportes de oto√±o" tambi√©n estar√°n practicando, pero el "tiempo de prioridad" comenzar√° el 12 de octubre, y los deportes de invierno seguir√°n eso. Podemos ver algunos gimnasios abiertos all√≠, sin embargo, as√≠ que no se demore en registrarse para la temporada 1.

shared_text:
Ash Creek Elementary School
September 8 at 11:06 AM ¬∑

Good Morning Ash Creek Families,

Due to poor air quality, all orientation meetings will be virtually today. If you requested an in person meeting for today, your child's teacher will be reaching out to you to confirm a Zoom meeting. Please let your child's teacher know, or contact the school office if you do not have internet access so that we can make special arrangements. Please stay safe.

With Thanks,

Ashley Wildfang
Principal, Ash Creek Elementary

Please let your child's teacher know, or contact the school office if you do not have internet access so that we can make special arrangements. Please stay safe.

With Thanks,

Ashley Wildfang
Principal, Ash Creek Elementary

Good morning families!
With the air quality alert in place from the National Weather Service, we are moving our orientations scheduled today. If you had an orientation today, please be sure to check your email, your Remind App, or your voicemail. We are working to move those meetings inside or online. Meals will be available at the regular times, 10 a.m. to noon, at all of our buildings and bus stops. Please drive up, and staff will come out to assist!
Remember to keep windows and doors closed today, and stay safe!

post_text:
Tomorrow! #CHSPanthers Orientation!

Please join us for CHS Panther Orientation on Thursday, September 3, 2020!

At orientation, you will have your school picture taken and receive your student ID card, pick up your student schedule and your 2019-2020 Yearbook, and receive a panther swag bag with a CHS reusable mask, support & contact info magnet, CHS handbook, bell schedule, and all the info you need for starting the 2020-21 school year!
When: Thursday, September 3
Where: CHS East Parking Lot

Freshmen
A-L 1:00-1:30 PM
M-Z 1:30-2:00 PM

Sophomores
A-L 2:00-2:30 PM
M-Z 2:30-3:00 PM

Juniors
A-L 3:00-3:30 PM
M-Z 3:30-4:00 PM

Seniors
A-L 4:00-4:30 PM
M-Z 4:30-5:00 PM

Make up time
5:00-6:30 PM

The week of September 2nd, your Panther Success Period (PSP) Advisory teacher will be calling to schedule an orientation conference with you and your student. These PSP Orientation Conferences will be set up to be virtual conferences. At your one on one conference, you will learn more about logging in to use our new learning platform to get ready for the first day of school.

shared_text:
Ash Creek Elementary PTA
September 1 at 10:39 PM ¬∑

Dear Families,

We look forward to connecting with each of you during our orientation meetings that begin tomorrow, Wednesday, 9/2. We are offering both in person and virtual meetings to support the needs of our families. Please confirm with your child‚Äôs teacher which option you prefer if you have not already done so. Families who have selected to meet virtually will receive meeting information directly from teachers.

The health and safety of our students, staff, parents and community is our top priority. Therefore, please carefully review the following guidance before arriving for scheduled, in person meetings.

Please put on masks when you arrive then walk towards the east side of the covered area and stop at one of the check-in stations. At the check-in station, families will be asked a series of health screening questions before meeting with teachers, masks will be required at all times for all people 5 years and older. Please call the school office to schedule a virtual meeting if you or anyone in your family has experienced any of the following symptoms in the past 48 hours: fever or chills, cough, shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, fatigue, muscle or body aches, headache, new loss of taste or smell, sore throat, congestion or runny nose, nausea or vomiting, diarrhea.

Kindergarten, first and second grade teachers will be meeting with families inside the gym. Families will enter through the doors on the east and exit through the doors to the west.

Third, fourth and fifth grade teachers will be meeting with families outside under the covered area. Families will enter on the east side and exit to the west.

Meetings are scheduled for 30 minutes with 30 minutes to clean between meetings.

We are asking that parents/caregivers bring only their students to the scheduled meetings in order to keep the number of people attending as few as possible. Students should also plan to bring their chromebooks to the meetings.

Our PTA will have designated spaces outside where caregivers can take photos of their students. We would love to have as many kids as possible take photos and post on social media! For safety, only students living in the same households will be allowed to take pictures together and masks will need to stay on at all times. There will be no props or enclosed spaces.

For safety, only the gym will be open while the rest of the building will remain closed. Restrooms and drinking fountains will not be accessible except in cases of true emergencies. Please bring water with you, we are expected to have very warm weather. All district playgrounds are also closed to the public.

We look forward to reconnecting with you as we prepare for the new school year together!

Ashley Wildfang

Principal, Ash Creek Elementary

Los maestros de kindergarten, primero y segundo grado se reunir√°n con las familias dentro del gimnasio. Las familias entrar√°n por las puertas del este y saldr√°n por las puertas del oeste.

Por seguridad, solo los estudiantes que viven en los mismos hogares podr√°n tomar fotograf√≠as juntos y las mascarillas deber√°n permanecer puestas en todo momento. No habr√° accesorios ni espacios cerrados.

Please bring water with you, we are expected to have very warm weather. All district playgrounds are also closed to the public.

We look forward to reconnecting with you as we prepare for the new school year together!

Ashley Wildfang

Principal, Ash Creek Elementary

Estimadas familias:

Esperamos poder conectarnos con cada uno de ustedes durante nuestras reuniones de orientaci√≥n que comienzan ma√±ana, mi√©rcoles 2 de septiembre. Ofrecemos reuniones presenciales y virtuales para apoyar las necesidades de nuestras familias. Por favor confirme con el maestro(a) de su hijo(a) qu√© opci√≥n prefiere si a√∫n no lo ha hecho. Las familias que hayan elegido reunirse virtualmente recibir√°n informaci√≥n sobre la reuni√≥n directamente de los maestros.

La salud y seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, personal, padres y comunidad es nuestra principal prioridad. Por lo tanto, revise cuidadosamente la siguiente gu√≠a antes de llegar a las reuniones programadas en persona.

Ponerse mascarilla cuando llegue, luego caminar hacia el lado este del √°rea cubierta y detenerse en una de las estaciones de registro. En la estaci√≥n de registro, a las familias se les har√° una serie de preguntas de evaluaci√≥n de salud antes de reunirse con los maestros, se requerir√°n mascarillas en todo momento para todas las personas de 5 a√±os en adelante. Llame a la oficina de la escuela para programar una reuni√≥n virtual si usted o alguien de su familia ha experimentado alguno de los siguientes s√≠ntomas en las √∫ltimas 48 horas: fiebre o escalofr√≠os, tos, falta de aire o dificultad para respirar, fatiga, dolores musculares o corporales, dolor de cabeza, reciente p√©rdida de olfato o del gusto, dolor de garganta, congesti√≥n o secreci√≥n nasal, n√°useas, v√≥mitos y diarrea.

Los maestros de kindergarten, primero y segundo grado se reunir√°n con las familias dentro del gimnasio. Las familias entrar√°n por las puertas del este y saldr√°n por las puertas del oeste.

Los maestros de tercer, cuarto y quinto grado se reunir√°n con las familias afuera debajo del √°rea cubierta. Las familias entrar√°n por el lado este y saldr√°n por el oeste.

Las reuniones est√°n programadas por 30 minutos con 30 minutos para limpiar entre reuniones.

Pedimos que los padres / cuidadores traigan solo a sus estudiantes a las reuniones programadas para mantener el n√∫mero de personas que asistir√°n al menor n√∫mero posible. Los estudiantes tambi√©n deben planear llevar sus chromebooks(dispositivo port√°til) a las reuniones.

Nuestra PTA(asociaci√≥n de padres) tendr√° espacios designados en el exterior donde los cuidadores pueden tomar fotograf√≠as de sus estudiantes. ¬°Nos encantar√≠a tener tantos ni√±os como sea posible tomando fotos y publicando en las redes sociales! Por seguridad, solo los estudiantes que viven en los mismos hogares podr√°n tomar fotograf√≠as juntos y las mascarillas deber√°n permanecer puestas en todo momento. No habr√° accesorios ni espacios cerrados.

Por seguridad, solo el gimnasio estar√° abierto mientras que el resto del edificio permanecer√° cerrado. Los ba√±os y bebederos no ser√°n accesibles excepto en casos de verdaderas emergencias. Por favor traer agua, se espera que tengamos un clima muy c√°lido. Todos los patios de recreo del distrito tambi√©n est√°n cerrados al p√∫blico.

¬°Esperamos volver a conectarnos con usted mientras nos preparamos para el nuevo a√±o escolar juntos!

Ashley Wildfang

Principal, Ash Creek Elementary





Central School District 13 J would like to continue connecting with you via email. If you prefer to be removed from our list, please contact Central School District 13 J directly. text:
Dear Families,

We look forward to connecting with each of you during our orientation meetings that begin tomorrow, Wednesday, 9/2. We are offering both in person and virtual meetings to support the needs of our families. Please confirm with your child‚Äôs teacher which option you prefer if you have not already done so. Families who have selected to meet virtually will receive meeting information directly from teachers.

The health and safety of our students, staff, parents and community is our top priority. Therefore, please carefully review the following guidance before arriving for scheduled, in person meetings.

Please put on masks when you arrive then walk towards the east side of the covered area and stop at one of the check-in stations. At the check-in station, families will be asked a series of health screening questions before meeting with teachers, masks will be required at all times for all people 5 years and older. Please call the school office to schedule a virtual meeting if you or anyone in your family has experienced any of the following symptoms in the past 48 hours: fever or chills, cough, shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, fatigue, muscle or body aches, headache, new loss of taste or smell, sore throat, congestion or runny nose, nausea or vomiting, diarrhea.

Kindergarten, first and second grade teachers will be meeting with families inside the gym. Families will enter through the doors on the east and exit through the doors to the west.

Third, fourth and fifth grade teachers will be meeting with families outside under the covered area. Families will enter on the east side and exit to the west.

Meetings are scheduled for 30 minutes with 30 minutes to clean between meetings.

We are asking that parents/caregivers bring only their students to the scheduled meetings in order to keep the number of people attending as few as possible. Students should also plan to bring their chromebooks to the meetings.

Our PTA will have designated spaces outside where caregivers can take photos of their students. We would love to have as many kids as possible take photos and post on social media! For safety, only students living in the same households will be allowed to take pictures together and masks will need to stay on at all times. There will be no props or enclosed spaces.

For safety, only the gym will be open while the rest of the building will remain closed. Restrooms and drinking fountains will not be accessible except in cases of true emergencies. Please bring water with you, we are expected to have very warm weather. All district playgrounds are also closed to the public.

We look forward to reconnecting with you as we prepare for the new school year together!

Ashley Wildfang

Principal, Ash Creek Elementary

Do you need a Chromebook? This afternoon from 3 to 7 p.m. at CHS in the east parking lot! Come check one out for the school year!

Chromebook Pick Up
Do you need a Chromebook for the year? Come to the District Chromebook Check Out event.
Students district-wide can check out a Chromebook, if needed, in the East Parking Lot of Central High School at the following times:
Tuesday, September 1 3-7 pm
If you have your own personal computer/laptop/device, you do not need to get a Chromebook. You are welcome to use your own personal device.

post_text:
Attention Central student-athletes and families! Important information about athletics for 2020-21:

Dear Central Student Athletes and Families,
Recently, the OSAA released further guidance in regards to interscholastic athletics and activities. This info is in conjunction with the Governor‚Äôs Office, ODE, and OHA. The OSAA calendar is broken up into 4 seasons with Season 1 beginning on Aug 31st.
-Season 1, Aug 31st- Dec 27th: This is a general sports season that allows all sports teams to hold workouts and modified practices; student participation is not required. More info will be coming with regard to teams and practice times.
-Season 2, Dec 28th- Mar 6th: Traditional Winter sports (Basketball, Wrestling and Swimming)
-Season 3 Feb 22nd- May 8th: Traditional Fall sports (Cross Country, Volleyball, Soccer, Football, Cheer)
-Season 4 Apr 19th-June 26th: Traditional Spring Sports (Golf, Tennis, Track & Field, Baseball, Softball)
Required Items Needed for Athletic Participation
1. A completed Physical Examination form--REQUIRED every two years for all students 9th - 12th grade prior to participating in extracurricular sports; Oregon State Board of Education mandates the use of the OSAA form.
2. Athletic Participation form with Insurance information--REQUIRED signed by both parent and student.
3. District Covid-19 Waiver form--REQUIRED
4. PT Northwest Consent forms Registration Process for Fall 2020

*Beginning August 31st no student will be allowed to participate without all required forms turned in*. **Homeschool students and students not registered at Central High School will need to get forms from the athletic office. Please call 503-606-2228 to arrange to pick up the forms.**
Pay to Play Fee
Our district normally requires a pay-to-play fee for all athletic participation. Club and activity participation fees vary depending on the program. There will be no fee charged for Season 1 participation, Season 2, 3, & 4 will be as normal.
‚óè $50 per sport
‚óè $150 per family per year cap
All of us associated with Central Athletics want to thank you, our student athletes and families, for your continued patience as we do our best to navigate these unique times. Our goal remains the same; to do all that we can to get our Panthers back out onto the field, the court, the trails, the mats, and in the pool so that they can have fun and compete in a safe and healthy environment.
Go Panthers! -Ryan
Ryan O‚ÄôMalley Athletic Director Central High School
Questions or Information: Ryan O‚ÄôMalley, Athletic Director: romalley@central.k12.or.us Denise Wallace, Athletic Secretary: dwallace@central.k12.or.us
24 de agosto, 2020
Estimados estudiantes-atletas y familias de la Escuela Preparatoria Central.
Recientemente, la OSAA (Asociaci√≥n de Actividades Escolares de Oregon) public√≥ m√°s orientaci√≥n con respecto al atletismo y las actividades interescolares. Esta informaci√≥n est√° en conjunci√≥n con la oficina de la gobernadora de Oregon, el ODE (Ministerio de Educaci√≥n de Oregon) y la OHA (Autoridad Sanitaria de Oregon). El calendario de la OSAA est√° dividido en 4 temporadas y la Temporada 1 comienza el 31 de agosto.
-Temporada 1, 21 de agosta a 27 de diciembre: √âsta es una temporada deportiva general que les permite a todos los equipos deportivos tener sesiones de entrenamiento y pr√°cticas modificadas; la participaci√≥n estudiantil no es requerida. Se les enviar√° m√°s informaci√≥n a los equipos sobre las horas de las pr√°cticas.
-Temporada 2,28 de diciembre a 6 de marzo: Deportes tradicionales del invierno (b√°squetbol, lucha libre y nataci√≥n)
Temporada3, 22 de febrero a 8 de mayo: Deportes tradicionales del oto√±o (carrera campo traviesa, v√≥libol, f√∫tbol americano, porrista)
Temporada 4, 19 de abril a 26 de junio: Deportes tradicionales de la primavera: (Golf, tenis, atletismo, b√©isbol, s√≥fbol)
Art√≠culos requeridos para la participaci√≥n en el atletismo
1. Un formulario completado de examen f√≠sico--- Se REQUIERE cada dos a√±os para todos los alumnos de 9¬∫ a 12¬∫ grado ates de que puedan participar en los deportes extracurriculares; la Junta Directiva de Educaci√≥n de Oregon exige el uso del formulario de la OSAA.
2. Formulario de Participaci√≥n en el Atletismo junto con la informaci√≥n sobre la aseguranza---se REQUIERE la firma de tanto de un padre de familia como del alumno.
3. Formulario de Eximici√≥n por Covid-19 distrital---REQUERIDO
4. Formularios de Consentimiento de PT Northwest

Proceso de inscripci√≥n para el oto√±o de 2020
En l√≠nea: se hacen las inscripciones a trav√©s del ‚Äúparent portal‚Äù de PowerSchool

*Comenzando el 31 de agosto no se le permitir√° a ning√∫n alumno participar sin haber entregado los formularios con anterioridad*. **Los alumnos educados en casa y los alumnos no inscritos en la Escuela Preparatoria Central tendr√°n que conseguir los formularios de la oficina de atletismo.Favor de llamar al 503-606-2228 para arreglar recoger los formularios.**

Cuotas para la participaci√≥n deportiva
Normalmente nuestro distrito requiere que se pague ciertas cuotas para toda participaci√≥n deportiva. Las cuotas para los clubs y las actividades var√≠an seg√∫n el programa.No se cobrar√° una cuota para la participaci√≥n de la Temporada1. Las cuotas de las Temporadas 2, 3 y 4 ser√°n las de costumbre:
‚Ä¢ $50 por deporte
‚Ä¢ $150 m√°ximo por familia por a√±o
Todas las personas asociadas con el Atletismo de Central queremos darles las gracias a ustedes, nuestros alumnos atletas y sus familias, por su paciencia continua mientras hacemos lo que podemos para navegar estos tiempos √∫nicos. Nuestra meta es la de siempre: hacer todo lo posible para que nuestras Panteras vuelvan al campo, la cancha, las pistas, los tapices y la piscina para que puedan divertirse y competir en un medio ambiente seguro y sano.
¬°Vivan las panteras!
-Ryan
Ryan O‚ÄôMalley
Director de Atletismo
Escuela Preparatoria Central

Preguntas o informaci√≥n:
Ryan O‚ÄôMalley, Director de Atletismo: romalley@central.k12.or.us
Denise Wallace, Secretaria de Atletismo: dwallace@central.k12.or.us

post_text:
Hello CSD 13J families,

Your Central School District staff are busy at work this week, learning, growing and stretching. They are getting ready to start the school year, with orientations for the first couple of weeks of September, followed by academic, social and emotional learning.

The year will not be without its bumps, but we are Central strong, and we know that we will get through it. Central staff have already been faced with challenges and overcome them quickly. We are certain that as we move forward, we will continue to show resilience. One thing we have learned already is how important it is that we all continue with more than one technology platform at our fingertips. We will be using the new K12 Fuel Education Academic Learning Platform while we continue to still have the functions of Google programs -- Google Classroom and Google Meet. It is important during this time that we have back-up platforms in case of a failure or shut down, which has been seen across the country already with several prominent learning platforms.

Because of the high volume of students being enrolled across the state and country, K12 Fuel Education is experiencing some delays. This prompted us to move back our student start date to Sept. 14. This will also give our teachers a few more days to connect with families through orientations. We are eager to get students started as soon as possible in this solid, teacher-supplemented academic content.

Meanwhile, please look for communication from your school building, your teachers and administrators. Log into your Chromebooks -- some of them may alert you if you need to make a switch. We will still be checking out Chromebooks to registered students who need one Aug. 31, 1 to 5 p.m., and Sept. 1, 3 to 7 p.m.

As we work to meet the health metrics, please continue to be safe, keep physical distance from others, and be well. We appreciate the support from all of you in our community.

post_text: At 1:00 pm today, we were made aware of an Instagram page where students were using our school name and logo in association with posts that were inappropriate and mean spirited. Our school does not tolerate bullying or harassment or sexual harassment of any kind. We are working with the police department and the Instagram abuse reports department to remove the posts, and we will be investigating the source of the Instagram page. Thank you to those of you who alerted us to this. We appreciate your partnership and Panther pride.

post_text:
Class of 2020! (And all other Panthers!) Important information about yearbooks!

2020 YEARBOOK DISTRIBUTION AND PURCHASE INFO!

WHEN?

THURSDAY, SEPT 3 as part of Orientation

2020 GRADUATES:

Yearbook pick up time is 10am-noon ONLY IN EAST Parking lot

Everyone else:

At Back to School Orientation--a whole event-- complete with school photos

& ID Cards, goodie bags, and yearbook!

Time slots listed below--details are in your school email.

STILL NEED TO BUY A YEARBOOK?

You can buy a book in advance for UNTIL SEPT 1

(or risk sell out, and purchase on site).

Your 2 methods to purchase a yearbook ($55):

PRE-ORDER (ends Sept 1)

Call the bookkeeper at 503-606-2506 between 9am-12pm (M-Th) through Sept 1. Leave a Voicemail with your phone number to receive a call back if she is unavailable. Make sure you answer your phone and have YOUR voicemail set up for when she calls back.

Current students (not grads) can purchase a yearbook through PowerSchool--make sure you select ‚Äú2020‚Äù (the ‚Äú2021‚Äù book is also for sale, but it doesn‚Äôt release until Spring or Fall); those who need login info., contact Jill Love at JLove@central.k12.or.us.

On-site (IF we don‚Äôt sell out first):

On Sept 3, during your time slot, you may pay via:

credit card

Check or cashier‚Äôs check

EXACT CHANGE CASH of $55 (in order to reduce Covid-19 spread, we will NOT be able to give you change, so be advised: if you give us more than $55 in cash, we will consider it a donation to Yearbook; we canNOT give out change)

AGAIN, BE ADVISED: there are a limited number of copies of the 19/20 yearbook, and we may sell out before Sept 1, so pre-order if you can.

Family members only may pick up yearbooks for grads; family members without current CHS students must adhere to the 10am-12pm slot. Family members with current CHS students may pick up graduates‚Äô yearbooks during the current student‚Äôs allotted time.

TIME SLOTS:

Current 10th graders (Class of 2023):

A-L 2pm-2:30

M-Z 2:30-3pm

Current 11th graders (Class of 2022):

A-L 3-3:30

M-Z 3:30-4pm

Current 12th graders (Class of 2021)

A-L 4-4:30

M-Z 4:30-5pm

Make-up time (NOTE: GRADS not allowed at this time):

5pm-6:30

(Current Frosh, Class of 2024, have CHS orientation 1-2pm as per email but will not receive CHS yearbooks since they were TMS students last year)

MAKE-UP YEARBOOK PICK UP TIME FOR ALL:

Friday, Sept 4

11am-1pm & 3pm-4pm

East Lot

Questions regarding yearbooks or yearbook distribution:

Lszymanski@central.k12.or.us

Attention CHS #Panthers!

Student schedules for Central High School students are available for viewing in PowerSchool. If students need to request an adjustment, there is a form for contacting school counselors in their student email. Please use the Google form to communicate any schedule adjustment requests.

If you need help to access PowerSchool, please call (503) 606-2215 or (503) 606-2225 during office hours (7:45 am to 3:15 pm).
Los horarios de los estudiantes de la Preparatoria Central est√°n disponibles para ver en PowerSchool. Si los estudiantes necesitan solicitar un ajuste, hay un formulario para contactar a los consejeros escolares en su correo electr√≥nico del estudiante. Favor de utilizar el formulario de Google para comunicar cualquier solicitud de ajuste de horario.

Si necesita ayuda para acceder a PowerSchool, llame al (503) 606-2215 o al (503) 606-2225 durante el horario de oficina de (7:45 am 3:15pm).

post_text:
Lots of information for CHS students here! This information went out on postcards last week!

Hello PANTHERS!!!
I hope that you have had a great summer. We are ready to start welcoming you back to school, and although we won't be together in the building, we will still be together in spirit! You will be receiving lots of information over the next few weeks. Please keep checking your email. It is really important for you to read your email so that you know what is going on. Here are a few important highlights of upcoming events. More information to follow next week.

Registration
Thank you for your patience through registration. We were having some technical difficulty and are happy that so many of you were able to complete the process over the phone. If you haven't yet registered, please call (503) 606-2225 or (503) 606-2215 and we will be happy to talk you through the process.

Chromebook Pick Up
Do you need a chromebook for the year? Come to the District Chromebook Check Out event.
Students district-wide can check out a chromebook, if needed, in the East Parking Lot of Central High School at the following times:
Thursday, August 27 1-5 pm
Monday, August 31 1-5 pm
Tuesday, September 1 3-7 pm
If you have your own personal computer/laptop/device, you do not need to get a chromebook. You are welcome to use your own personal device.

Student Schedules
Your schedule will be made available on PowerSchool next week. We will also be handing out schedules at our Panther Orientation Event on Thursday, September 3. Keep checking your email for more information about your schedule.

Please join us for CHS Panther Orientation on Thursday, September 3, 2020!
At orientation, you will have your school picture taken and receive your student I.D card, pick up your student schedule and your 2019-2020 Yearbook, and receive a panther swag bag with a CHS reusable mask, support & contact info magnet, CHS handbook, bell schedule, and all the info you need for starting the 2020-21 school year!

When: Thursday, September 3

Where: CHS East Parking Lot

Freshmen

A-L 1:00-1:30 PM

M-Z 1:30-2:00 PM

Sophomores

A-L 2:00-2:30 PM

M-Z 2:30-3:00 PM

Juniors

A-L 3:00-3:30 PM

M-Z 3:30-4:00 PM

Seniors

A-L 4:00-4:30 PM

M-Z 4:30-5:00 PM

Make up time

5:00-6:30 PM



The week of September 2nd, your PSP Advisory teacher will be calling to schedule an orientation conference with you and your parent/guardian. These PSP Orientation Conferences will be set up to be virtual conferences. At your one on one conference, you will learn more about logging in to use our new learning platform to get ready for the first day of school.

SEPTEMBER 10 is the first day of logging in for classes.

Classes and Panther Success Period (PSP)

A copy of the weekly schedule is shown below.

Office Hours are optional. Your teachers will be available during office hours to answer questions you might have. They will share information for how to contact them for office hours.

Class periods are set up for students in the HYBRID model. If you are a hybrid student, you will log in for class following the "bell schedule" below. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, you will attend your A DAY classes (periods 1A, 2A, 3A).

On Wednesdays and Fridays you will attend your B DAY classes (periods 1B, 2B, 3B). You will also log in for PSP every day (highlighted in yellow). Outside of your class periods, you will be working online to complete the coursework and assessments needed to earn the credit for the class. Students in the VIRTUAL LEARNING ACADEMY (VLA) will not be logging on for class each day, but will instead be watching instructional videos or doing readings to learn in a more independent way.

ALL students whether hybrid or VLA will need to log in for PSP every day from 11:45-12:15 starting on the first day of school. PSP will be an essential way for you to get the information you need as a student for the 2020-21 school year.

Make sure you set this up as part of your daily routine.

Grading

Detailed information about course grading will be shared by your classroom teachers. CHS students in the hybrid and VLA models will be issued letter grades A-D for credit earned and a No Pass (NP) when credit has not been earned. Students will need to recover credit for No Pass in order to stay on track to earn their high school diploma.



Important Upcoming Dates

August 24-28 Please call to register if you haven't registered yet! (503) 606-2225 or
(503) 606-2215. This is staff inservice week, so there may be times when we are unable to answer the phone as staff will be in training. Please leave a message and we will return your call as soon as we are able.

August 24 Student schedules made available through PowerSchool

Check your student email for updates and information

September 3 CHS Panther Orientation Event (IN PERSON)

September 3, 4, 5 PSP Orientation Conferences

September 7 Labor Day Holiday

September 8, 9 PSP Orientation Conferences

September 10 FIRST DAY OF SCHOOL--we are starting in comprehensive distance learning, so you won't come to the building, but you will LOG IN to start your 2020-21 school year. You will get directions for logging in at your one on one orientation conference with your PSP Teacher.

Class periods are set up for students in the HYBRID model. If you are a hybrid student, you will log in for class following the "bell schedule" below. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, you will attend your A DAY classes (periods 1A, 2A, 3A).

On Wednesdays and Fridays you will attend your B DAY classes (periods 1B, 2B, 3B). You will also log in for PSP every day (highlighted in yellow). Outside of your class periods, you will be working online to complete the coursework and assessments needed to earn the credit for the class. Students in the VIRTUAL LEARNING ACADEMY (VLA) will not be logging on for class each day, but will instead be watching instructional videos or doing readings to learn in a more independent way.

ALL students whether hybrid or VLA will need to log in for PSP every day from 11:45-12:15 starting on the first day of school. PSP will be an essential way for you to get the information you need as a student for the 2020-21 school year.

Make sure you set this up as part of your daily routine.

Grading

Detailed information about course grading will be shared by your classroom teachers. CHS students in the hybrid and VLA models will be issued letter grades A-D for credit earned and a No Pass (NP) when credit has not been earned. Students will need to recover credit for No Pass in order to stay on track to earn their high school diploma.



Important Upcoming Dates

August 24-28 Please call to register if you haven't registered yet! (503) 606-2225 or
(503) 606-2215. This is staff inservice week, so there may be times when we are unable to answer the phone as staff will be in training. Please leave a message and we will return your call as soon as we are able.

August 24 Student schedules made available through PowerSchool

Check your student email for updates and information

September 3 CHS Panther Orientation Event (IN PERSON)

September 3, 4, 5 PSP Orientation Conferences

September 7 Labor Day Holiday

September 8, 9 PSP Orientation Conferences

September 10 FIRST DAY OF SCHOOL--we are starting in comprehensive distance learning, so you won't come to the building, but you will LOG IN to start your 2020-21 school year. You will get directions for logging in at your one on one orientation conference with your PSP Teacher.

post_text: Free art kits for kids this morning, while supplies last, at 10 a.m. at Ash Creek Arts Center!
shared_text:
Maia Jones shared a post to the group: Monmouth Elementary School Parents.
August 22 at 8:26 AM ¬∑

Reminder: Ash Creek Arts is handing out free art kits for kids this morning at 10:00 am!

Ash Creek Arts Center
August 22 at 8:14 AM ¬∑

Reminder: Ash Creek Arts is handing out free art kits for kids this morning at 10:00 am!

Our last round of art kits were so popular that we decided to make a new set of kits. This time we have 100 kits to give out with 3 activities in each. The kits contain 3 simple but versatile art activities, each with materials and written instructions. Each kit will have 3 of the following activities:

-Air Dry Clay Creatures
-Watercolor Exploration
-Sun Catcher Jellyfish
-Make Your Own Tunnel Book

Kits are intended for K-8 students.
______________________________

To pick up a kit:

Drive up (or walk up) to the Ash Creek Arts Center starting at 10:00 am on Saturday morning.

(311 S Monmouth Street in Independence)

We will be outside to hand out kits to vehicles or walkers.

We will be wearing masks - please wear a mask as well.

Limit of 4 kits per family/vehicle.

We have 100 kits to hand out on a first come, first served basis.

shared_text:
Ash Creek Elementary PTA
August 14 at 3:09 PM ¬∑

Greetings, Ash Creek Families! Summer is winding down and your PTA has some information regarding the official start date for school.

The start date for both curriculum pathways and all students is Thursday, September 10. This includes the hybrid pathway which will begin in comprehensive distance learning and the fully online CSD Virtual Academy.

September 2-4, 8 and 9 there will be family orientation meetings and conferences planned to help familiarize school communities with the new platform.

We aren't sure what the schedule for those meetings is yet, but as soon as we know more, we'll share this information with our families.

Please let us know if you have any questions and we will try to get answers for you. Enjoy the rest of Summer!

post_text:
Hello Central School District Families! Below please find today's communication that went out via email and voicemail. More information will be shared about activities as we are still working through what this might look like at the high school level.

¬°Hola familias del Distrito Escolar Central! A continuaci√≥n encontrar√° la comunicaci√≥n de hoy que se envi√≥ por correo electr√≥nico y correo de voz. Se compartir√° m√°s informaci√≥n sobre las actividades, ya que todav√≠a estamos trabajando a trav√©s de lo que esto podr√≠a parecer en el nivel de la escuela preparatoria.

Dear CSD 13J Families,

We are weeks away from the start of school! Even though school will start with everyone online in the CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy, we are asking all families to choose your pathway -- hybrid (a mix of in-person learning and online learning) and online only. We are asking for parents to choose a pathway for one semester at a time. We need this information so that we can prepare schedules and staffing once it is safe to resume in-person learning based on the health metrics outlined by the state. The initial deadline was August 10th, however we are taking surveys to identify your child‚Äôs preferred pathway up to 8 p.m. tonight, Aug. 12th. If the survey is not completed, students will be automatically enrolled in the hybrid program. Please email info@central.k12.or.us if you have any questions or concerns and visit our website www.central.k12.or.us to complete the survey.

We know a lot of our families have been wondering about sports for fall. We have received guidance and made some tough decisions at both middle and high school levels regarding sports. Due to the continued spread of the Coronavirus, and after reviewing guidance from the state, the Mid-Valley Middle School athletic league has cancelled all fall sports seasons. Talmadge Middle school will not have fall sports or training for our student athletes. The league will continue to monitor the situation and make decisions about the winter sports seasons in the fall. If you have questions please call the school office at 503-606-2252.

OSAA has released its sports schedule for 2020-21 student athletes. Traditional fall sports will be moved to March.

"Traditional Winter activities will take place in January and February (Season 2), followed by Fall activities in March and April (Season 3), with Spring activities occurring in May and June (Season 4). Each season will feature an equitable 7-week regular season, with adjusted contest limitations, followed by an OSAA Culminating Week," the OSAA guidance states.

At this time, Central School District will continue to allow voluntary workouts through August.

Now is a great time to start getting back into a routine and getting ready for learning. Some suggestions include setting a regular bedtime and morning alarm, scheduling a regular time to go for a walk or do something outdoors, or eating a meal at the same time each day. Dust off a notebook and start writing or drawing about how this summer has been different from others -- what's been good about it? What's been disappointing?

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,

¬°Estamos a semanas del comienzo de la escuela! A pesar de que la escuela comenzar√° con todos los alumnos en l√≠nea en la academia virtual de aprendizaje CSD 13J, estamos pidiendo a todas las familias que elijan su opci√≥n: h√≠brido (una mezcla de aprendizaje en persona y aprendizaje en l√≠nea) y solamente en l√≠nea. Estamos pidiendo que los padres elijan un camino para un semestre a la vez. Necesitamos esta informaci√≥n para poder preparar horarios y personal una vez que sea seguro reanudar el aprendizaje en persona basado en las m√©tricas de salud descritas por el estado. La fecha l√≠mite inicial era el 10 de agosto, sin embargo, estamos tomando encuestas para identificar la opci√≥n preferida de su hijo hasta las 8 p.m. de esta noche, el 12 de agosto. Si la encuesta no se completa, los estudiantes se inscribir√°n autom√°ticamente en el programa h√≠brido. Por favor, env√≠e un correo electr√≥nico info-central.k12.or.us si tiene alguna pregunta o inquietud y visite nuestro sitio web www.central.k12.or.us para completar la encuesta.

Sabemos que muchas de nuestras familias se han estado preguntando sobre los deportes para el oto√±o. Hemos recibido orientaci√≥n y tomamos algunas decisiones dif√≠ciles tanto en los niveles de la escuela media como en la preparatoria con respecto a los deportes. Debido a la continua propagaci√≥n del Coronavirus, y despu√©s de revisar la gu√≠a del estado, la liga atl√©tica de Mid-Valley Middle School ha cancelado todas las temporadas deportivas de oto√±o.La secundaria de Talmadgeno tendr√° deportes de oto√±o o entrenamiento para nuestros atletas estudiantes. La liga continuar√° monitoreando la situaci√≥n y tomando decisiones sobre las temporadas de deportes de invierno en el oto√±o. Si tiene preguntas, llame a la oficina de la escuela al 503-606-2252.

OSAA ha lanzado su calendario deportivo para los estudiantes atletas del 2020-21. Los deportes tradicionales de oto√±o se trasladar√°n a marzo.

"Las actividades tradicionales de invierno tendr√°n lugar en enero y febrero (temporada 2), seguidas de las actividades de oto√±o en marzo y abril (temporada 3), con actividades de primavera que se llevar√°n a cabo en mayo y junio (temporada 4). Cada temporada contar√° con una temporada regular equitativa de 7 semanas, con limitaciones de concurso ajustadas, seguida de una semana culminante de la OSAA", afirma la gu√≠a de la OSAA.

En este momento, el Distrito Escolar Central continuar√° permitiendo entrenamientos voluntarios hasta agosto.

Ahora es un buen momento para volver a una rutina y prepararse para el aprendizaje. Algunas sugerencias incluyen establecer una alarma regular para acostarse y por la ma√±ana, programar una hora regular para ir a caminar o hacer algo al aire libre, o comer una comida a la misma hora todos los d√≠as. Qu√≠tale el polvo a un cuaderno y comienza a escribir o dibujar sobre c√≥mo este verano ha sido diferente de otros -- ¬øqu√© ha sido bueno sobre √©l? ¬øQu√© ha sido decepcionante?

Hemos recibido orientaci√≥n y tomamos algunas decisiones dif√≠ciles tanto en los niveles de la escuela media como en la preparatoria con respecto a los deportes. Debido a la continua propagaci√≥n del Coronavirus, y despu√©s de revisar la gu√≠a del estado, la liga atl√©tica de Mid-Valley Middle School ha cancelado todas las temporadas deportivas de oto√±o.La secundaria de Talmadgeno tendr√° deportes de oto√±o o entrenamiento para nuestros atletas estudiantes. La liga continuar√° monitoreando la situaci√≥n y tomando decisiones sobre las temporadas de deportes de invierno en el oto√±o. Si tiene preguntas, llame a la oficina de la escuela al 503-606-2252.

OSAA ha lanzado su calendario deportivo para los estudiantes atletas del 2020-21. Los deportes tradicionales de oto√±o se trasladar√°n a marzo.

"Las actividades tradicionales de invierno tendr√°n lugar en enero y febrero (temporada 2), seguidas de las actividades de oto√±o en marzo y abril (temporada 3), con actividades de primavera que se llevar√°n a cabo en mayo y junio (temporada 4). Cada temporada contar√° con una temporada regular equitativa de 7 semanas, con limitaciones de concurso ajustadas, seguida de una semana culminante de la OSAA", afirma la gu√≠a de la OSAA.

En este momento, el Distrito Escolar Central continuar√° permitiendo entrenamientos voluntarios hasta agosto.

Ahora es un buen momento para volver a una rutina y prepararse para el aprendizaje. Algunas sugerencias incluyen establecer una alarma regular para acostarse y por la ma√±ana, programar una hora regular para ir a caminar o hacer algo al aire libre, o comer una comida a la misma hora todos los d√≠as. Qu√≠tale el polvo a un cuaderno y comienza a escribir o dibujar sobre c√≥mo este verano ha sido diferente de otros -- ¬øqu√© ha sido bueno sobre √©l? ¬øQu√© ha sido decepcionante?

CHS Informational meetings TODAY! Zoom starts at 1. See more below:

We know you have a lot of questions. To help families make the choice between the Virtual Learning Academy and the Hybrid Model, we will be hosting four parent/student meetings this Friday, August 7th. The meetings will be scheduled by grade level. You're welcome to attend any of the four sessions, but we are trying to provide for smaller groups and grade-level specific answers.

The meetings will take place TODAY, Friday, August 7th.
1:00-1:45 9th grade
2:00-2:45 10th grade
3-3:45 11th grade
4-4:45 12th grade

Again, you are welcome to attend ANY of the sessions in order to meet your scheduling demands.

post_text:
Due to COVID 19 and current restrictions on gathering sizes, all back to school events this year will be happening in a drive-thru system.

Unlike in years past, families must pre-register in order to receive supplies.

Once families are registered, they will receive a packet in the mail with details on when and where they will be able to access their school supplies.

post_text:
A message from Principal Servignat:
Good evening,

I know that families have a lot of questions. Emails have been coming in, and I am working on sending answers so that you have the information you need to choose the option that is the best fit for your student. We did not have a lot of time for question/answer at the presentations on Monday and Tuesday. To help families make the choice between the Virtual Learning Academy and the Hybrid Model, we will be hosting four parent/student meetings this Friday, August 7th. The meetings will be scheduled by grade level. You're welcome to attend any of the four sessions, but we are trying to provide for smaller groups and grade-level specific answers.

We will review the main differences between Hybrid and Virtual Learning Academy, present a set of questions for your family to consider in order to help you make this decision, and answer questions that you may have. If you are not able to attend, we will record and post the meetings on the district web page.

Please know that we care about you. We want to make these options work for students. Often, there are small adjustments we can make to meet your needs if we are aware of your concerns or worries. We are limited in being able to meet every request because of constraints we may have for staffing or for programming, but we will do our very best to try to make this the best situation we can for you and for your family. As a parent myself, I know how difficult this is. Please reach out if you need to ask.

The meetings will take place on Friday, August 7th.
Freshman | 1pm - 1:45pm
Sophomores | 2pm - 2:45pm
Juniors | 3pm - 3:45pm
Seniors | 4pm - 4:45pm

Again, you are welcome to attend ANY of the sessions in order to meet your scheduling demands.

To access the meeting, click on the Zoom link or join by phone:

Join Zoom Meeting
https://zoom.us/j/95470080117‚Ä¶

Meeting ID: 954 7008 0117
Passcode: 536053

Join by phone:
+12532158782+95470080117
+13462487799

Thank you,

Donna Servignat
CHS Principal

post_text:
Central School District 13J families,
We received updated information from the governor, Oregon Health Authority and the Oregon Department of Education on July 28, where county and health metrics were released.
We now have clear guidance on how and when we can reopen in-person learning safely, based on these metrics. Under the current metrics, Central School District has decided to open the 2020-21 school year in a comprehensive distance learning model at least through November.
For more information about our local health metrics: www.central.k12.or.us, click on 2020-21 Planning on the left-hand side.

Central has partnered with Fuel Education to create a CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy, which will give us the tools to provide a rigorous online education for all students, whether they participate in the pathway of hybrid (in-person and online) or the pathway of online only. It also will give us the flexibility to flow in and out of online-only learning as the health metrics demand.

"We are excited about the partnership with Fuel Education K-12 because it is grounded in the core standards and allows for teachers to adapt the lessons to meet the needs of our learners," says Donna Servignat, principal of Central High School and one of the co-leads on the Instruction Committee. "It is user friendly for teachers, students and families. There are language and accessibility supports."
Based on input from stakeholders, the focus has been on providing students with an equitable, comprehensive, and high-quality educational program taught and supported by CSD teachers and staff. Central will offer two instructional pathways (Hybrid or CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy) for students to engage in a comprehensive educational program for the 2020-21 school year. Both options will provide individual and group learning experiences, as well as opportunities to stay connected with their local peers, while they receive daily instruction and support from CSD 13J teachers and staff.
Family Information sessions are scheduled for next week to provide an overview of the Fuel Education K-12 online program with time for questions. Here is the zoom link for all the informational sessions https://zoom.us/j/95835370266 or call in to participate by phone using either 1-253-215-8782 or 1-669-900-9128.
We are asking families to make a commitment to one of the instructional pathways -- either hybrid or CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy -- by August 10. Those who choose a hybrid option will be online only through at least November based on current health metric trends. Here is the link to the Choose Your Instructional Pathway survey. (please go to https://tinyurl.com/y2uf382k).

The upcoming key dates for community informational meetings about CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy are:
Monday, Aug. 3:
8-9 a.m. Elementary Schools
9-10 CSD Staff
5-6 p.m. Central High School
6-7 p.m. Talmadge Middle School
7-8 p.m. Elementary Schools
Tuesday, Aug. 4:
8-9 a.m. Central High School
Wednesday, Aug. 5:
8-9 a.m., Talmadge Middle School

Here is a link to the most recent version of Ready Schools, Safe Learners.

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,

Recibimos informaci√≥n actualizada de la gobernadora, la Autoridad de Salud de Oreg√≥n y el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n el 28 de julio, donde se publicaron m√©tricas de salud del condado. Bajo las m√©tricas actuales, el Distrito Escolar Central ha decidido abrir el a√±o escolar 2020-21 en un modelo integral de aprendizaje a distancia al menos hasta noviembre. Para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n sobre nuestras m√©tricas de salud locales: www.central.k12.or.us, haga clic en planificaci√≥n del 2020-21 del lado izquierdo de la p√°gina web.

El Distrito Escolar Central (CSD) se ha asociado con ‚ÄúFuel Education‚Äù para crear una academia virtual de CSD 13J, que nos dar√° las herramientas para proporcionar una educaci√≥n en l√≠nea rigurosa para todos los estudiantes, ya sea que participen en forma h√≠brida (en persona y en l√≠nea) o de forma virtual, en l√≠nea solamente. Tambi√©n nos dar√° la flexibilidad de fluir dentro y fuera del aprendizaje solo en l√≠nea a medida que las m√©tricas de salud lo vayan requiriendo.

"Estamos entusiasmados con la asociaci√≥n con Fuel Education K-12 porque se basa en los est√°ndares b√°sicos y permite que los maestros adapten las lecciones para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros estudiantes", dice Donna Servignat, directora de la Preparatoria Central (CHS) y una de las co directoras del Comit√© de Instrucci√≥n. "Es f√°cil de usar para profesores, estudiantes y familias. Hay apoyos de idioma y accesibilidad".

Basado en las aportaciones de las partes interesadas, el enfoque se ha centrado en proporcionar a los estudiantes un programa educativo equitativo, integral y de alta calidad impartido y apoyado por los maestros y el personal de CSD. El Distrito Central ofrecer√° dos v√≠as educativas (h√≠brida o por medio de la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J) para que los estudiantes participen en un programa educativo integral para el a√±o escolar 2020-21. Ambas opciones proporcionar√°n experiencias de aprendizaje individuales y grupales, as√≠ como oportunidades para mantenerse conectados con sus compa√±eros locales, mientras reciben instrucci√≥n diaria y apoyo de los maestros y el personal del CSD 13J.

Las sesiones de informaci√≥n familiar est√°n programadas para la pr√≥xima semana para proporcionar una visi√≥n general del programa en l√≠nea K-12 de Fuel Education con tiempo para preguntas. Aqu√≠ est√° el enlace de zoom para todas las sesiones informativas: https://zoom.us/j/95835370266 o llame para participar por tel√©fono hablando al 1-253-215-8782 o 1-669-900-9128.

Pedimos a las familias que se comprometan con una de las v√≠as de instrucci√≥n -- ya sea h√≠brida o por medio de la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J - antes del 10 de agosto. Aquellos que elijan una opci√≥n h√≠brida estar√°n en l√≠nea solo hasta noviembre en funci√≥n de las tendencias actuales de las m√©tricas de salud. Aqu√≠ est√° el enlace a la encuesta para elegir su camino instructivo. (por favor vaya a https://tinyurl.com/y2uf382k).

Las pr√≥ximas fechas clave para las reuniones informativas de la comunidad sobre la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J son:

text:
Central School District 13J families,
We received updated information from the governor, Oregon Health Authority and the Oregon Department of Education on July 28, where county and health metrics were released.
We now have clear guidance on how and when we can reopen in-person learning safely, based on these metrics. Under the current metrics, Central School District has decided to open the 2020-21 school year in a comprehensive distance learning model at least through November.
For more information about our local health metrics: www.central.k12.or.us, click on 2020-21 Planning on the left-hand side.

Central has partnered with Fuel Education to create a CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy, which will give us the tools to provide a rigorous online education for all students, whether they participate in the pathway of hybrid (in-person and online) or the pathway of online only. It also will give us the flexibility to flow in and out of online-only learning as the health metrics demand.

"We are excited about the partnership with Fuel Education K-12 because it is grounded in the core standards and allows for teachers to adapt the lessons to meet the needs of our learners," says Donna Servignat, principal of Central High School and one of the co-leads on the Instruction Committee. "It is user friendly for teachers, students and families. There are language and accessibility supports."
Based on input from stakeholders, the focus has been on providing students with an equitable, comprehensive, and high-quality educational program taught and supported by CSD teachers and staff. Central will offer two instructional pathways (Hybrid or CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy) for students to engage in a comprehensive educational program for the 2020-21 school year. Both options will provide individual and group learning experiences, as well as opportunities to stay connected with their local peers, while they receive daily instruction and support from CSD 13J teachers and staff.
Family Information sessions are scheduled for next week to provide an overview of the Fuel Education K-12 online program with time for questions. Here is the zoom link for all the informational sessions https://zoom.us/j/95835370266 or call in to participate by phone using either 1-253-215-8782 or 1-669-900-9128.
We are asking families to make a commitment to one of the instructional pathways -- either hybrid or CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy -- by August 10. Those who choose a hybrid option will be online only through at least November based on current health metric trends. Here is the link to the Choose Your Instructional Pathway survey. (please go to https://tinyurl.com/y2uf382k).

The upcoming key dates for community informational meetings about CSD 13J Virtual Learning Academy are:
Monday, Aug. 3:
8-9 a.m. Elementary Schools
9-10 CSD Staff
5-6 p.m. Central High School
6-7 p.m. Talmadge Middle School
7-8 p.m. Elementary Schools
Tuesday, Aug. 4:
8-9 a.m. Central High School
Wednesday, Aug. 5:
8-9 a.m., Talmadge Middle School

Here is a link to the most recent version of Ready Schools, Safe Learners.

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,

Recibimos informaci√≥n actualizada de la gobernadora, la Autoridad de Salud de Oreg√≥n y el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n el 28 de julio, donde se publicaron m√©tricas de salud del condado. Bajo las m√©tricas actuales, el Distrito Escolar Central ha decidido abrir el a√±o escolar 2020-21 en un modelo integral de aprendizaje a distancia al menos hasta noviembre. Para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n sobre nuestras m√©tricas de salud locales: www.central.k12.or.us, haga clic en planificaci√≥n del 2020-21 del lado izquierdo de la p√°gina web.

El Distrito Escolar Central (CSD) se ha asociado con ‚ÄúFuel Education‚Äù para crear una academia virtual de CSD 13J, que nos dar√° las herramientas para proporcionar una educaci√≥n en l√≠nea rigurosa para todos los estudiantes, ya sea que participen en forma h√≠brida (en persona y en l√≠nea) o de forma virtual, en l√≠nea solamente. Tambi√©n nos dar√° la flexibilidad de fluir dentro y fuera del aprendizaje solo en l√≠nea a medida que las m√©tricas de salud lo vayan requiriendo.

"Estamos entusiasmados con la asociaci√≥n con Fuel Education K-12 porque se basa en los est√°ndares b√°sicos y permite que los maestros adapten las lecciones para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros estudiantes", dice Donna Servignat, directora de la Preparatoria Central (CHS) y una de las co directoras del Comit√© de Instrucci√≥n. "Es f√°cil de usar para profesores, estudiantes y familias. Hay apoyos de idioma y accesibilidad".

Basado en las aportaciones de las partes interesadas, el enfoque se ha centrado en proporcionar a los estudiantes un programa educativo equitativo, integral y de alta calidad impartido y apoyado por los maestros y el personal de CSD. El Distrito Central ofrecer√° dos v√≠as educativas (h√≠brida o por medio de la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J) para que los estudiantes participen en un programa educativo integral para el a√±o escolar 2020-21. Ambas opciones proporcionar√°n experiencias de aprendizaje individuales y grupales, as√≠ como oportunidades para mantenerse conectados con sus compa√±eros locales, mientras reciben instrucci√≥n diaria y apoyo de los maestros y el personal del CSD 13J.

Las sesiones de informaci√≥n familiar est√°n programadas para la pr√≥xima semana para proporcionar una visi√≥n general del programa en l√≠nea K-12 de Fuel Education con tiempo para preguntas. Aqu√≠ est√° el enlace de zoom para todas las sesiones informativas: https://zoom.us/j/95835370266 o llame para participar por tel√©fono hablando al 1-253-215-8782 o 1-669-900-9128.

Pedimos a las familias que se comprometan con una de las v√≠as de instrucci√≥n -- ya sea h√≠brida o por medio de la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J - antes del 10 de agosto. Aquellos que elijan una opci√≥n h√≠brida estar√°n en l√≠nea solo hasta noviembre en funci√≥n de las tendencias actuales de las m√©tricas de salud. Aqu√≠ est√° el enlace a la encuesta para elegir su camino instructivo. (por favor vaya a https://tinyurl.com/y2uf382k).

Las pr√≥ximas fechas clave para las reuniones informativas de la comunidad sobre la academia de aprendizaje virtual de CSD 13J son:

post_text:
Congratulations to Michele Haney for being selected for this grant! Here's what she plans to do with it! #Distancedoesntstopus #WeareCentral

"I will use the funds to help create art kits to go home to families for fall distance learning. I'm committed to multidisciplinary art experiences in and outside the classroom (and however learning occurs this year)! These kits will be made available to families who might benefit from a few extra supplies.

"Though the supplies in each kit will be limited, they will enable me to work alongside students with similar materials just as we would do in the classroom and learn techniques that require the use of particular materials that students may not already have at home. I am just striving for the most engaging experience for all, as all Central teachers are! :)

"If any community members believe they may have new or gently used materials they feel could be a fun inclusion to the art kits, they are welcome to email me!"

Email info@central.k12.or.us, and we will get the information to Ms. Haney quickly!

July 27 at 4:17 PM ¬∑

The City of Monmouth Arts & Culture Commission is happy to announce the grant recipients of the annual grant program. This year the Commission awarded grants to the following key partners: Smith Fine Arts Series, Ash Creek Art Center, New Horizons Orchestra and Michelle Haney, Talmadge Middle School art teacher. Additionally, the Commission purchased art from the WOU Foundation to support WOU art students. Congratulations to the recipients!

post_text:
Hello CSD 13J families and community! Here is the latest update for our families:

Dear CSD 13J families,
We hope you are having a safe and fun summer! We are busily preparing for the 2020-21 school year, putting the pieces together so that students and staff can safely return to learning.

Last week, all of our subcommittees met and reviewed the tasks ahead. Some of the requirements we have ready. Many will require more details, and some will need to be created.
We are putting finishing touches on a webpage dedicated to the work our subcommittees are doing so that you can stay as informed as you want to be. On this page, you can get brief summaries of each committee, and read more about what they are working on. It will be updated weekly, and found on our website, central.k12.or.us.

We also are expanding the way we communicate by adding more videos. Starting this week, we will begin recording and posting the video of the weekly Community Committee meetings, as well as a short update video message from Superintendent Dr. Jennifer Kubista. These videos come in addition to our other methods of communication: email, voicemail, website updates, Facebook, the Remind App, and flyers in the mail or at meal pickup sites.

Your feedback remains important to us throughout this process. If you have questions, suggestions, or would like more information about a topic, please email us at info@central.k12.or.us, or send us a message on Facebook.

Stay safe, and remember to wash your hands! We are #CentralStrong and we will get through this, together! Take care.

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,
¬°Esperamos que tengas un verano seguro y divertido! Hemos estado muy ocupados preparando todo para el a√±o escolar 2020-21; reuniendo las piezas para que los estudiantes y el personal puedan volver con seguridad al aprendizaje.
La semana pasada, todos nuestros subcomit√©s se reunieron y revisaron las tareas que se avecinaba. Algunos de los requisitos ya los tenemos listos. Muchos requerir√°n m√°s detalles, y algunos tendr√°n que ser creados.
Estamos poniendo los toques finales en una p√°gina web dedicada al trabajo que nuestros subcomit√©s est√°n haciendo para que pueda mantenerse tan informado como desee. En esta p√°gina, puede obtener breves res√∫menes de cada comit√© y leer m√°s sobre lo que est√°n trabajando. Se actualizar√° semanalmente y se encontrar√° en nuestro sitio web, central.k12.or.us
Tambi√©n estamos ampliando la forma en que nos comunicamos a√±adiendo m√°s v√≠deos. A partir de esta semana, comenzaremos a grabar y publicar el video de las reuniones semanales del comit√© de la comunidad, as√≠ como un breve mensaje de video de actualizaci√≥n de Superintendente Dr. Jennifer Kubista. text:
Hello CSD 13J families and community! Here is the latest update for our families:

Dear CSD 13J families,
We hope you are having a safe and fun summer! We are busily preparing for the 2020-21 school year, putting the pieces together so that students and staff can safely return to learning.

Last week, all of our subcommittees met and reviewed the tasks ahead. Some of the requirements we have ready. Many will require more details, and some will need to be created.
We are putting finishing touches on a webpage dedicated to the work our subcommittees are doing so that you can stay as informed as you want to be. On this page, you can get brief summaries of each committee, and read more about what they are working on. It will be updated weekly, and found on our website, central.k12.or.us.

We also are expanding the way we communicate by adding more videos. Starting this week, we will begin recording and posting the video of the weekly Community Committee meetings, as well as a short update video message from Superintendent Dr. Jennifer Kubista. These videos come in addition to our other methods of communication: email, voicemail, website updates, Facebook, the Remind App, and flyers in the mail or at meal pickup sites.

Your feedback remains important to us throughout this process. If you have questions, suggestions, or would like more information about a topic, please email us at info@central.k12.or.us, or send us a message on Facebook.

Stay safe, and remember to wash your hands! We are #CentralStrong and we will get through this, together! Take care.

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,
¬°Esperamos que tengas un verano seguro y divertido! Hemos estado muy ocupados preparando todo para el a√±o escolar 2020-21; reuniendo las piezas para que los estudiantes y el personal puedan volver con seguridad al aprendizaje.
La semana pasada, todos nuestros subcomit√©s se reunieron y revisaron las tareas que se avecinaba. Algunos de los requisitos ya los tenemos listos. Muchos requerir√°n m√°s detalles, y algunos tendr√°n que ser creados.
Estamos poniendo los toques finales en una p√°gina web dedicada al trabajo que nuestros subcomit√©s est√°n haciendo para que pueda mantenerse tan informado como desee. En esta p√°gina, puede obtener breves res√∫menes de cada comit√© y leer m√°s sobre lo que est√°n trabajando. Se actualizar√° semanalmente y se encontrar√° en nuestro sitio web, central.k12.or.us
Tambi√©n estamos ampliando la forma en que nos comunicamos a√±adiendo m√°s v√≠deos. A partir de esta semana, comenzaremos a grabar y publicar el video de las reuniones semanales del comit√© de la comunidad, as√≠ como un breve mensaje de video de actualizaci√≥n de Superintendente Dr. Jennifer Kubista. Estos videos vienen adem√°s de nuestros otros m√©todos de comunicaci√≥n como son: correo electr√≥nico, correo de voz, actualizaciones del sitio web, Facebook, la aplicaci√≥n Recordar y folletos en el correo o en los sitios de donde recoge las comidas.
Sus comentarios siguen siendo importantes para nosotros durante todo este proceso. Si tienes preguntas, sugerencias o quieres m√°s informaci√≥n sobre un tema, env√≠anos un correo electr√≥nico a info-central.k12.or.us o env√≠anos un mensaje en Facebook.

Chemeketa Community College
July 8 at 4:24 PM ¬∑

Attention High School Students and Grads: We would like to invite you to learn more about some of the degree opportunities at Chemeketa. Join us on July 16th from 11:30 to 1:00 for our first Zoom event! Register at https://forms.gle/mGaoZcQBVprrqdNW8 and let us know which programs you are interested in learning about. post_text:
Preguntas frecuentes: Entrenamientos voluntarios de atletismo en el verano Estos entrenamientos NO son necesarios para participar en los programas de atletismo del Distrito Central.

P: ¬øEsto es s√≥lo pr√°cticas para la preparatoria, o las pr√°cticas de deportes de la escuela secundaria estar√°n operando tambi√©n?
R: Estos son entrenamientos de acondicionamiento y fuerza de verano para estudiantes de 9o a 12o grado involucrados en cualquier equipo deportivo (oto√±o, invierno o deportes de primavera). Esto no est√° abierto a estudiantes de 6o a 8o grado.

P: ¬øQu√© pasa si mi hijo est√° entrando al noveno grado? ¬øC√≥mo se ponen en contacto con los entrenadores para formar parte de las pr√°cticas, ya que no ha habido inscripci√≥n?
R: Los estudiantes pueden recoger esta noche de 5 a 7 p.m. en la Preparatoria Central (CHS) en el estacionamiento detr√°s del estadio, para obtener la documentaci√≥n apropiada para llenar los requisitos para ser elegibles para participar en entrenamientos de acondicionamiento y fuerza de verano. (Todos los novatos entrantes asistir√°n a la sesi√≥n dos a partir de las 10:15.)

P: ¬øTodos los deportes de oto√±o est√°n haciendo esto?
R: Los entrenamientos de fuerza y acondicionamiento de verano son para estudiantes de 9o a 12o grado involucrados en cualquier equipo deportivo (oto√±o, invierno o deportes de primavera).

P: ¬øC√≥mo se entregar√°n los formularios cuando recojamos la forma de exoneraci√≥n de responsabilidad? ¬øpodemos imprimirlos en l√≠nea para que no tengamos que ir a la escuela en lo absoluto?
R: Los formularios se entregar√°n el 2 de julio de 5 a 7 pm en el estacionamiento detr√°s del estadio y se pueden descargar de la p√°gina de Facebook del distrito o del sitio web e imprimirlos.

P: ¬øC√≥mo podemos detener la propagaci√≥n si permitimos que comience el acondicionamiento? A medida que aumentan las cifras, ¬øpor qu√© permitir√≠a el distrito que esto sucediera? (Ahora las m√°scaras son obligatorias en los negocios)
R: Todas las actividades realizadas se ajustar√°n a las pautas establecidas por los CDC, la OHA, el NFHS y la OSAA para las pr√°cticas y la capacitaci√≥n permitidas actualmente.

P: ¬øC√≥mo pueden los entrenadores evitar que no suden por todo el equipo y luego 10 ni√±os m√°s lo toquen? ¬øHay equipo?
R: Las actividades de fuerza y acondicionamiento se llevar√°n a cabo al aire libre, y todos y cada uno de los equipos se desinfectar√°n en cada uso.

P: ¬øSe permite a los estudiantes usar esas botellas de agua de oprimir y compartirlas con amigos si sus labios no los tocan?
A: Todos los estudiantes deben traer su propia botella de agua. No se permite compartir agua. Si es necesario, se puede disponer de una estaci√≥n de recarga sin contacto.

P: ¬øCu√°l es la orientaci√≥n del Superintendente si un estudiante-atleta contrata covid-19 mientras est√° en acondicionamiento?
R: Los estudiantes no deben venir a las pr√°cticas si muestran alg√∫n signo de estar enfermo, o si sospechan que han estado expuestos a alguien con COVID-19 o cualquier otra enfermedad. Los s√≠ntomas incluyen tos, escalofr√≠os, fiebre, dolor de garganta, dolor muscular, dificultad para respirar o falta de aire, y nueva p√©rdida del sentido del gusto o del olfato. Todos los entrenadores y estudiantes ser√°n examinados diariamente para detectar signos / s√≠ntomas de COVID-19 antes de participar. Las respuestas a las preguntas de detecci√≥n de cada persona se registrar√°n y almacenar√°n junto con su temperatura tomada a trav√©s de un term√≥metro sin contacto. A cualquier persona con s√≠ntomas positivos reportados no se le permitir√° participar, debe auto aislarse y comunicarse con su proveedor m√©dico u otro profesional de la salud.

P: ¬øC√≥mo va a evitar que la escuela mantenga a nuestros atletas socializando en los estacionamientos despu√©s de que se haga el acondicionamiento? ¬øSeguir√°n en los terrenos de la escuela, as√≠ que t√©cnicamente es responsabilidad de las escuelas mantenerlos separados? R: Se comunicar√° claramente a lo largo del tiempo de los estudiantes en el campus para adherirse a todas y cada una de las regulaciones. El personal dejar√° claro y aconsejar√° a los estudiantes-atletas que no se queden en el estacionamiento despu√©s de estas pr√°cticas y entrenamientos voluntarios. Se aconsejar√° a los estudiantes que se alejen f√≠sicamente entre s√≠ mientras esperan a los padres/familiares.
