post_text:
Central School District families,

This week, our elementary students logged into online learning to see their teachers and each other! Thanks to all of your efforts in helping make our online learning successful. Our teachers and staff have been working hard to create a program that will work for everyone, and we continue to learn, build, adapt, adjust -- and do it again.

Have you seen the news? Those families who are on free and reduced lunches will see some additional benefits on their EBT cards. If a family does not have an EBT card, but qualifies for free and reduced lunch, they will receive a card with instructions. In these unprecedented times, we know many have had changes in their household incomes. If your family has been affected, you may apply for free and reduced lunch virtually here. Meanwhile, Central School District will continue its meal program at schools and bus stops. For more details, click here.

Wednesday, we launched our district WiFi in the East parking lot of Central High School. The WiFi is for district-issued Chromebooks. Directions and hours of operation are posted on the bus that is parked there. Hours will be 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Monday through Friday next week, starting May 11. We are working on more access points, but are waiting on equipment. We ask that you remain in your car if you can, and please maintain physical distancing while using WiFi. We will also have walk-up stations (physically distant, 6 feet or more apart) for students at the site. Safety and security of our families and community are of utmost importance.

Need to check out a Chromebook from the district? We will have a makeup station set up at the District Office, 750 S. Fifth St., Independence, from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day next week, May 11-15.

One of the things the Oregon Department of Education requires us to do is continue after school programming. We are pleased to announce our At Home After School programs will kick off next week with a great lineup of STEM, arts and crafts, STRIDE, and more! After school programs are optional. This is not required coursework, but fun activities to help break up your day. Programs are geared toward K-8. Staff will share more information this week, with flyers to be delivered next week during meal distribution. To register, click here.

Central High School students may purchase their yearbooks on Powerschool. Parents must be logged in to make the purchase. You must login through a parent account while using a desktop or using the following URL. It does not work on a phone. To purchase a yearbook from Talmadge Middle School, email the bookkeeper, Jessica Steed, jsteed@central.k12.or.us. We are waiting to hear more about possible yearbooks from Ash Creek, Independence and Monmouth elementary schools.

We appreciate your patience and grace through these difficult times. Things seem to be changing often as we all adjust to new guidance. We received some questions from the community that Superintendent Kubista answered at Monday‚Äôs board meeting. The meeting can be viewed on our website for those who missed the livestream. If you have questions, reach out to us at info@central.k12.or.us, or message us on Facebook.

Familias del Distrito Central,

Nuestros maestros y personal han estado trabajando duro para crear un programa que funcione para todos, y seguimos aprendiendo, construyendo, adapt√°ndonos, adapt√°ndose y haci√©ndolo de nuevo.

El mi√©rcoles, lanzamos nuestro Wifi del distrito en el estacionamiento este de Preparatoria Central. La conexi√≥n Wifi es para Chromebooks del distrito. Las direcciones y horas de operaci√≥n est√°n fijadas en el autob√∫s que est√° estacionado all√≠. El horario ser√° de 8 a.m. a 10 p.m. de lunes a viernes la pr√≥xima semana, a partir del 11 de mayo. Estamos trabajando en m√°s puntos de acceso, pero estamos esperando a que llegue el equipo. Le pedimos que permanezca en su coche si puede, y por favor mantenga el distanciamiento f√≠sico mientras usa Wifi. Tambi√©n tendremos estaciones de acceso (f√≠sicamente distantes, 6 pies o m√°s de distancia) para los estudiantes en el sitio de la escuela. Agradecemos su paciencia y gracia a trav√©s de estos tiempos dif√≠ciles. Las cosas parecen estar cambiando a menudo, ya que todos nos adaptamos a una nueva gu√≠a. Recibimos algunas preguntas de la comunidad que la superintendente Kubista respondi√≥ en la reuni√≥n de la junta del lunes. La reuni√≥n se puede ver en nuestro sitio web para aquellos que se perdieron la transmisi√≥n en vivo. Si tienes alguna pregunta, ponte en contacto con nosotros en info-central.k12.or.us o env√≠anos un mensaje en Facebook.

Contestant Highlight Day 5 is Chayann Partain! She is the daughter of Tamra Rober and was born on September 24th 2001. Her favorite quote is ‚ÄúWhen given the choice between what's right and what's kind, CHOOSE KIND.''

#MrandMsCentral #pageant #Panthers #CASA
shared_text:
Mr. and Ms. Central Pageant 2019-2020
May 8 at 10:24 AM ¬∑

Contestant Highlight Day 5 is Chayann Partain! She is the daughter of Tamra Rober and was born on September 24th 2001. Her favorite quote is ‚ÄúWhen given the choice between what's right and what's kind, CHOOSE KIND ''. If she could have any superpower it would be to ‚ÄúGive the ‚Äúone more day‚Äù with a person you have just lost to hopefully give reassurance that they are in a better place‚Äù. The greatest influence in her life has been ‚ÄúMy uncle, he is one of my favorite people and has been such a great support for my siblings and I. We all look to him as a father figure because he is constantly there for us. Thank you uncle Bubba. I love you.‚Äù Her favorite year or high school was ‚ÄúA combination of Junior and Senior year. A lot happened to me that really pushed/ challenged me to grow and step out of my comfort zone. At the moment I didn't know that it was good for me but now I am thankful for everything I went through because I am stronger and more confident because of it‚Äù. Keep on the lookout for more content from Chay today!

post_text:
Contestant Highlight Day 4 is Chase Magill! He is the son of Melissa and Joe Magill and was born on October 2, 2001. His favorite quote is "A wealth accumulator is soon remembered only by the way he used it. Knowledge is the same" - Reuben A. Long.

#MrandMsCentral #Pageant #CASA #Panthers
shared_text:
Mr. and Ms. Central Pageant 2019-2020 added a new photo to the album: Chase Magill.
May 7 at 5:00 PM ¬∑

Contestant Highlight Day 4 is Chase Magill! He is the son of Melissa and Joe Magill and was born on October 2, 2001. His favorite quote is "A wealth accumulator is soon remembered only by the way he used it. Knowledge is the same" - Reuben A. Long. When asked if you could have a superpower what would of be and why, he said ‚Äúyou know that song or word that's always on the tip of your tongue. I'd like to be able to know exactly what it is that's so despairingly eluding me within at least one minute consistently so I'd know just the right song or phrase for every moment of my life‚Äù. The person who has the greatest influence in his life is,
‚ÄúMy late grandfather, Edmund Magill, has held a lasting impact throughout my life irrespective of when he was there and now when he's not. He was there for many critical moments in my life and I live now knowing he's still there in the way I choose to lead my life each day‚Äù. He states his favorite year of high school was ‚ÄúThe summer of 2019, that acted as the predecessor to my final year of high school, was a period of incredible growth and self discovery. That summer really set the stage for my Senior year to be a tremendous time of reflecting on pleasant memories and experiences all while preparing for my future as a prospective college student‚Äù. Keep watching our page for more from Chase today!

post_text:
Contestant Highlight Day 3! Meet Bailey Padilla, daughter of Jessie and Toby Padilla, and born on January 25, 2002. Her favorite quote is ‚ÄúI don't need easy, I just need possible."

#MrandMsCentral #pageant #CASA #Panthers
shared_text:
Mr. and Ms. Central Pageant 2019-2020
May 6 at 10:00 AM ¬∑

Contestant Highlight Day 3! Meet Bailey Padilla, daughter of Jessie and Toby Padilla, and born on January 25, 2002. Her favorite quote is ‚ÄúI don't need easy, I just need possible". Her ideal superpower is super speed, "so that I would never have to worry about being late... and if I am I could just run around the world fast enough to turn back time!". The person who has had the greatest influence on her life is her mom! Bailey states, ‚ÄúShe has shown me that even when life gets tough and you don't have much support you can do anything you set your mind to, and you can do it extraordinarily‚Äù. Her favorite year of high school has been senior year, ‚ÄúI have gotten closer to and gained many new friendships and knowing that I will be gone in a year I have spent a lot of my time having fun and making amazing memories with my friends and family.‚Äù

post_text:
As the Central School District embraces distance learning and works to continue growth and connection during our new normal, we are grateful for our teachers and staff as they work so hard to love and support all of our students from a distance.

At the same time, we are reminded how much it really does take a whole village to raise a whole child and we are incredibly proud of our "village."
Thank you Monmouth and Independence for all of the support as we face the challenges of Covid-19. We got this. #WeAreCentral #Distancelearning

https://youtu.be/jC-pofRH2pI

post_text:
Do you have unreliable WiFi access to work on #distancelearning? Do you know someone who does? Please help spread the word about the district WiFi hotspots. The first one at Central High School goes live tomorrow morning at 8.

Central School District announces WiFi access

To the Central School District 13J community,
We are pleased to announce the soft launch of our district WiFi available in the East parking lot at Central High School from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. on Wednesday, May 6, and from 8 a.m.t o 4 p.m. on Thursday, May 7, and Friday, May 8.

The parking lot will be staffed to offer light user support, as well as educate users on maintaining social distancing. We are asking users to remain in their cars. The WiFi is for district-issued Chromebooks. Instructions will be posted around the parking lot and distributed on site.

We will expand district WiFi to other locations and extend hours as quickly as we can.

Nos complace anunciar el lanzamiento de nuestra conexi√≥n de Wifi del distrito, disponible en el estacionamiento del lado este en la Preparatoria Central de 8 a.m. a 3 p.m. el mi√©rcoles, 6 de mayo, y a partir de las 8 a.m. o 4 p.m. del jueves, 7 de mayo y viernes, 8 de mayo.
El estacionamiento estar√° rodeado de personal entrenadas para ofrecer un ligero apoyo al usuario, as√≠ como educar a los usuarios sobre el mantenimiento del distanciamiento social. Pedimos a los usuarios que permanezcan en sus coches. El Wifi es para Chromebooks prestados por el distrito. #MrandMsCentral #Pageant #distancelearning #CASA
shared_text:
Mr. and Ms. Central Pageant 2019-2020
May 5 at 10:15 AM ¬∑

Contestant Highlight Day 2, meet Harrison Eberly! Harrison is the son of Troy Eberly & Allison Hursh, and was born on February 2, 2002. His favorite quote is, "Better to fight for something than live for nothing." George S. Patton. If he could have any superpower it would be psychokinesis, because "I could levitate and move things with my mind". The greatest influence in his life is his dad. Harrison states "He has always been there for me and he has taught me a lot of important lessons". His favorite year of high school has been junior year, because, "I had a lot of fun and I didn't really have to stress about things like pageant and grades". Be on the look out for more content from Harrison throughout the day!

Meet Hazel Lydum, she is the daughter of Randi and Matt Lydum and born on September 12th 2001. Her favorite quote is, ‚Äúbe the change you wish to see in the world‚Äù - Gandhi. If she could have any superpower it would be to make anyone happy at any time!

#MrandMsCentral #pageant #CASA
shared_text:
Mr. and Ms. Central Pageant 2019-2020
May 4 at 9:40 AM ¬∑

Contestant Highlight Days have begun! Meet Hazel Lydum, she is the daughter of Randi and Matt Lydum and born on September 12th 2001. Her favorite quote is, ‚Äúbe the change you wish to see in the world‚Äù - Gandhi. If she could have any superpower it would be to make anyone happy at any time! The greatest influence in her life has been her grandma Hazel because, "she taught me how to love everyone whole heartedly and gave me her name". Her favorite year of high school has been senior year because she had so many new experiences and been changed for the better! Be on the look out for more content from Hazel today!

post_text:
Family update for May 1
Central School District 13J families,
We hope you are all staying safe and healthy during these unprecedented times. We were glad to see the sun out during our final week of Chromebook checkouts to elementary school students. An all-grade Chrome makeup day will be Wednesday, May 6, from 4 to 8 p.m. at the high school. Anyone who has missed checking out a Chromebook may come during that time. We are working to get WiFi access points and hotspots available to our students. We anticipate the equipment needed will arrive soon, but it has been behind because the entire country has a new demand for this type of equipment. We will let you know when we know more.

We know that everyone and every family are handling the Stay Home, Save Lives order differently. If you or your student is feeling stressed, remember that resources are available. Everything for Central Health and Wellness mental health services, as well as our other mental health services for youth and families, is available by phone registration and will be set up to happen by video (Hangout Meet). It is confidential and safely provided to the individual in their home. Polk County Behavioral Health Services: Registration & Services by Phone.

Polk County Behavioral Health is OPEN and provides all services through TELEHEALTH (Video/phone), starting with phone registration and scheduling for services. Polk County Behavioral Health offers individual, family and group therapy, skills training, Wraparound Program, Crisis Services, Psychiatric Medication Management and EASA (Early Psychosis) programs. Interpreters are also involved as requested. Technology assistance is available as needed for this service. Also, please see this important link: Telehealth Tips: Clients with Suicide Risk.

As we enter our sixth week of providing meal service to students and youth aged 0 to 18, we‚Äôve nearly reached 60,000 meals served, breakfast and lunch! To make it even easier to pick up meals for your children, the meal services program has a form to fill out, enabling picking up meals without children present, or picking up meals for the entire week at one time. We recommend bringing grocery bags or a box with you if you pick up for the entire week at a time. See this link for more information: Meal pickup program

We have all experienced a change in our lives, routines and, for some, in our household incomes. If you have seen a change in your household, know that the state of Oregon has changed some of its requirements to join programs such as SNAP benefits for food, as well as joining the Oregon Health Plan for medical benefits.

The three pillars for distance learning include caring for students health and well-being; supplemental materials such as the packets families receive in the mail; and online learning. This is the second week of online learning for Central High School students and teachers, and it‚Äôs going well. Each week teachers and students learn something new. As we learn, we refine the process.

‚ÄúWe are seeing more and more students engaging online and are continually improving our approach to distance learning,‚Äù Principal Donna Servignat said. ‚ÄúWe are excited to be able to continue to connect with our students. We miss them!‚Äù
This is the first week for teachers and students at Talmadge Middle School to be online learning.
‚ÄúIt has been a great week at Talmadge as we started online distance learning for our students,‚Äù Principal Perry LaBounty said. ‚ÄúTeachers were thrilled to reconnect with many students and are looking forward to meeting with all of their classes. The vast majority of TMS students have signed into Google Classrooms and are officially back at school. We will continue to support students and families who don't have internet access at this time with instructional packets.‚Äù
With Chromebooks in the hands of our youngest students, elementary school will begin the online learning portion of our distance learning for all plan next week!

The CSD13J Board of Directors will meet at 6:30 p.m. on Monday, May 4, via livestream. If you have any questions for the board, please email info@central.k12.or.us, or message us on our Facebook page. The agenda will be posted on the district‚Äôs website and Facebook page.

We appreciate your grace and patience with us, and hope that you will continue to share that same grace and patience with each other and yourselves. Nothing about this is easy. We are Central, and we are proud to be a part of this community.

Familias del Distrito Escolar Central,
Esperamos que todos se mantengan seguros y sanos durante estos tiempos sin precedentes. Nos alegramos de ver salir el sol durante nuestra √∫ltima semana de entregas de Chromebook a estudiantes de primaria. Para los que no pudieron recoger una, independientemente del grado en el que este, podr√° hacerlo el mi√©rcoles 6 de mayo, de 4 a 8 p.m. en la Preparatoria Central (CHS). Si falta alg√∫n alumno de recoger su computadora Chromebook, puede obtener una ese d√≠a. Estamos trabajando para obtener puntos de acceso WiFi y puntos de acceso disponibles para nuestros estudiantes. Anticipamos que el equipo necesario llegar√° pronto, pero se ha atrasado porque todo el pa√≠s tiene una nueva demanda de este tipo de equipos. Le avisaremos cuando sepamos m√°s informaci√≥n.

Sabemos que todos y cada familia est√°n manejando las √≥rdenes de qu√©date en casa, salva vidas, de manera diferente. Si usted o su estudiante se sienten estresados, recuerde que los recursos est√°n disponibles. Todo para los servicios de salud mental del Centro de Salud y Bienestar de Central, as√≠ como otros servicios de salud mental para j√≥venes y familias, est√° disponible por registro telef√≥nico y se configurar√° para que suceda por video (por medio de la aplicaci√≥n Hangout Meet). Es confidencial y se proporciona de forma segura a la persona en su hogar. Servicios de Salud Conductual del Condado de Polk: Registro & Servicios por Tel√©fono.

La Salud Conductual del Condado de Polk esta ABIERTA y proporciona todos los servicios a trav√©s de TELEHEALTH (Video/tel√©fono), comenzando con el registro telef√≥nico y la programaci√≥n de servicios. La Salud Conductual del Condado de Polk ofrece terapia individual, familiar y grupal, capacitaci√≥n en habilidades, programa desfavorable, servicios de crisis, manejo de medicamentos psiqui√°tricos y programas EASA (Psicosis Temprana). Hay int√©rpretes disponibles si lo solicitan. La asistencia tecnol√≥gica est√° disponible seg√∫n sea necesario para este servicio. Tambi√©n, por favor vea este importante enlace: Consejos de Tele salud: Clientes con Riesgo de Suicidio.

Al entrar en nuestra sexta semana de proporcionar servicio de comidas a estudiantes y j√≥venes de 0 a 18 a√±os, ¬°hemos llegado a casi 60,000 comidas servidas, entre desayunos y almuerzos! Para que sea a√∫n m√°s f√°cil recoger las comidas para sus hijos, el programa de servicios de comidas tiene un formulario para llenar, lo que permite recoger comidas sin ni√±os presentes, o recoger comidas para toda la semana a la vez. Recomendamos llevar bolsas contigo, para poner la comida o una caja si recoges toda la comida de la semana a la vez. Consulte este enlace para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n: Programa para recoger comidas

Todos hemos experimentado un cambio en nuestras vidas, rutinas y, para algunos, en nuestros ingresos familiares. Si ha visto un cambio en su hogar, sepa que el estado de Oregon ha cambiado algunos de sus requisitos para unirse a programas como beneficios de SNAP para alimentos, as√≠ como unirse al Plan de Salud de Oregon para beneficios m√©dicos.

Los tres pilares para el aprendizaje a distancia incluyen el cuidado de la salud y el bienestar de los estudiantes; materiales suplementarios como los paquetes que las familias reciben por correo; y el aprendizaje en l√≠nea. Esta es la segunda semana de aprendizaje en l√≠nea para los estudiantes y profesores de la Escuela Preparatoria Central, y va bien. Cada semana, los maestros y los estudiantes aprenden algo nuevo. A medida que aprendemos y refinamos el proceso.
"Estamos viendo a m√°s y m√°s estudiantes interactuando en l√≠nea y estamos mejorando continuamente nuestro enfoque de la ense√±anza a distancia", dijo la directora Donna Servignat. "Estamos emocionados de poder seguir conect√°ndonos con nuestros estudiantes. ¬°Los echamos de menos!"
Esta es la primera semana para que los profesores y estudiantes de la Secundaria Talmadge se conecten al aprendizaje en l√≠nea.
"Ha sido una gran semana en la Escuela Secundaria Talmadge (TMS) al empezar el aprendizaje a distancia en l√≠nea para nuestros estudiantes", dijo el director Perry LaBounty. "Los maestros estaban encantados de reconectarse con muchos estudiantes y est√°n deseando reunirse con todas sus clases. La gran mayor√≠a de los estudiantes de TMS han iniciado sesi√≥n en las aulas de Google y est√°n oficialmente de vuelta en la escuela. Continuaremos apoyando a los estudiantes y familias que no tienen acceso a Internet en este momento con los paquetes de instrucci√≥n".
Con sus Chromebooks en manos de nuestros estudiantes m√°s peque√±os; ¬°la escuela primaria tiene programado comenzar el aprendizaje en l√≠nea, del programa aprendizaje a distancia para todos, la pr√≥xima semana!
El Consejo de Administraci√≥n del Distrito Escolar Central 13J (CSD13J) se reunir√° a las 6:30 p.m. del lunes 4 de mayo a trav√©s de la transmisi√≥n en vivo. Si tiene alguna pregunta para la mesa directiva, env√≠e un correo electr√≥nico a info-central.k12.or.us o env√≠enos un mensaje en nuestra p√°gina de Facebook. La agenda se publicar√° en el sitio web del distrito y en la p√°gina de Facebook.
Agradecemos su amabilidad y paciencia con nosotros, y esperamos que contin√∫en compartiendo esa misma amabilidad y paciencia el uno con el otro y con ustedes mismos. Nada de esto es f√°cil. Somos parte del Distrito Central, y estamos orgullosos de ser parte de esta comunidad.

post_text:
Here are some details about the board's decision to purchase the land at 1483 N. 16th St., Monmouth:
Central School District Board of Directors approves purchase

At the live-streamed meeting on April 6, the Central School District Board of Directors unanimously approved buying the land at 1483 N. 16th St., Monmouth, formerly Ash Creek Bible School and Mid-Valley Christian Academy.

The purchase price was $775,000 and consists of 2.36 acres, a 9,374-square-foot building, and 3 (Action) double modular buildings, along with a shed, parking lot for approximately 48 vehicles and various appliances, improvements, and personal property that would constitute a flexible and complementary property to district buildings and operations along 16th Street.

The money used to buy the land will come from the Construction Excise Taxes. This fund is dedicated to expand capacity or support facilities for district learning and operations. Before the purchase was approved, the fund sat at $1.5 million.

‚ÄúWe are in the fortunate position to have capital funds available for a purchase like this,‚Äù said Steve Love, Board Chair. ‚ÄúAt the same time, we're planning to dispose of two surplus properties. We're essentially exchanging properties to get a facility that is very flexible and can be adopted in a number of ways to fit into our long term plans.‚Äù

The future uses of this property, due to its size and close proximity to existing facilities, to supplement district operations make this purchase a prudent investment. It will not replace the need for investments in capacity to serve students, but gives the district options while it explores the community needs and potential growth.

The availability of this property was not part of the district‚Äôs long-range plans, but the Board feels it is right to take advantage of the opportunity to secure it for the future. The added flexibility it gives the district to serve the needs of students, staff and families during the unprecedented school closure was an unanticipated benefit.

With this purchase, the district will be able to accomplish both short-term and long-term goals.
The buildings can be used immediately as a training center, office space for four or five people, and an additional kitchen.
During the closures amid Covid-19 concerns, families are able to pick up enough food to feed them through the weekends. Now, more families could benefit, because the property at 1483 N. 16th St. affords more kitchen and storage space.
If district enrollment continues on an upward trend, the three double modular buildings provide room for as many as 130 additional students, and are ready to deploy to serve needs for additional space.
Two large spaces, one already equipped with projection technology, may allow for future site-based distance learning for students who are unable to access it from home. Or, for training staff in a larger space to maintain physical distances.
With its proximity to our schools, this purchase allows the district to build future facilities and create new programs or enhance existing ones.

For the past year, our district has been developing a strategic plan that focuses on student achievement and growth, family involvement, community partnerships, and ongoing investment and development of our district team, Love said. We also had been aligning our plan with the Oregon Student Success Act, which is going to provide additional funding in a variety of areas.

‚ÄúAt the same time, we were seeing our enrollment increase at a rate higher than surrounding districts,‚Äù Love added. ‚ÄúIt was becoming clear that we were going to need additional space to support the programs we are building into our strategic plan. The opportunity to purchase a very flexible facility that formerly served as a school made a great deal of sense. It provides us tremendous flexibility and will feed right into our long range facilities plan.‚Äù

post_text:
In case you missed it, the Principal Chat with the Class of 2020 video from yesterday's livestream is on the district website and linked below.

Some quotes from Principal Servignat:
You matter. All the staff at Central High School care about you very deeply.
You have what it takes to cross this finish line, and finish it well.
We want you to not just survive this pandemic; we want you to feel equipped for this journey, experience strength and have a great story to tell.
You're more resilient than you think.
Get comfortable with change, because this is just the beginning.
Prepare for the positives. There will be beautiful moments; don't miss them.
Don't forget to take care of yourself.

For Spanish subtitles, click on the settings, click on subtitles, turn on English subtitles. Then click on settings again, click on subtitles again, choose "auto translate" and choose your language. This will enable the Spanish text.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=6L9CJC9CT5Y&feature=youtu.be

What will graduation for the Class of 2020 look like? How will seniors get their diplomas?

These are just a few things Principal Servignat will speak about in tomorrow's live stream, "Chat with the Principal" at 3:30 p.m. What's on your mind? Let us know by commenting here, on the event posting on our page, or by emailing info@central.k12.or.us -- OR use this Padlet! https://padlet.com/dservignat1/4095iw09cxh9no5y

The event is to address all things related to our seniors, and open to all. The link for the livestream can be found online at wou.edu/livestream2 It will also be live on WIMPEG's local TV station, which is EZvideo channel 21.

Questions not relating to seniors will be addressed at another time.

post_text:
Seniors! What's on your mind? Principal Servignat will host a "Chat with the Class of 2020" Thursday at 3:30 p.m., livestreamed from Western Oregon University! Share your ideas, thoughts, concerns.

Principal Chat with the Class of 2020
We know you have a lot on your mind and LOTS of questions about end of the school year as well as our traditional events. Tell us what you're thinking about or worrying about using this PADLET. We will be reviewing your comments and looking for themes that we can address in a LIVE VIDEO conference "Principal Chat with the Class of 2020" on Thursday, April 30 at 3:30 pm. The link for the livestream can be found online at wou.edu/livestream2 Please note: there is a link about the video box for Android/and Apple devices--viewers must click the play button; it does not autoplay. It will also be live on WIMPEG's local TV station, which is EZvideo channel 21. We look forward to being able to talk to you and share the answers to your questions

post_text:
School closure/distance learning update 4-24-
Update on distance learning and school closures
April 24, 2020
Central School District families,
We are wrapping up a week of online learning for Central High School students and staff, and are making adjustments as we go so that it will be the best experience for all. Per guidance from the Oregon Department of Education, students in grades 9-11 will receive a pass/incomplete in lieu of a letter grade for quarters 3 and 4. To ease anxiety over grades, the grade book will be turned off to student and parent view. Please look for more information and guidance from your building principals.
In all grades, ODE strongly recommends against retaining students. Instead, schools will work to build plans as we begin to look toward the 2020-21 school year. Please give us grace and be patient as more information will be shared as we move forward.
CHS Principal Donna Servignat will be hosting a ‚ÄúPrincipal Chat with the Class of 2020‚Äù at 3:30 p.m. on April 30. The chat will be a live stream, filmed at Western Oregon University. Watch for future communication for a link to the live chat.
Meanwhile, students and teachers at Talmadge Middle School will be going to online learning starting Monday. Here is the new teacher directory for the middle school, with links to teachers‚Äô Google Sites: https://sites.google.com/central.k12.or.us/tms-dl-directory/home
We recently received guidance for students in grades K-8 from the Oregon Department of Education. We are going over what exactly that means for students, families and staff, and will let you know as soon as possible.
As we move into virtual ‚Äúlive‚Äù meetings/classrooms with our staff, we want to make you aware that these Google ‚Äúlive‚Äù meetings will be recorded for the safety of the students as well as the staff. Students may opt out of turning on their video in these meetings and still attend classes. Also, please remind your students that just because we are not in classrooms, classroom expectations and etiquette still apply. Please refrain from obscene language and dress appropriately. More information and expectations will be shared in these virtual live classroom settings by the classroom teachers. Please also watch in the mail next week more information related to live virtual classrooms.
Also, Gov. Kate Brown released a new executive order Thursday that may offer some new opportunities as well as challenges as we move forward. For the immediate impact, we know her order now extends through June 30. We will update you as we know more.
Chromebook and essential item pickup went well at Talmadge Middle School ‚Äì thank you all who helped make the process go smoothly! We are working on a way to ensure that any student who missed the designated Chromebook pickup days, as well as those who still have personal items at the schools, will be able to get what they need.
Chromebook pickup for elementary school students begins Monday at 8 a.m. for fifth-graders, and at noon on Monday for fourth grade. Third grade starts at 8 a.m. Tuesday, followed by second grade at noon. First grade is scheduled at 8 a.m. Wednesday, with kindergarteners at noon. All Chromebook checkouts will be at Central High School.
To avoid long lines and maintain social distancing, please come according to the your last name:
Mornings: Afternoons:
A-G: 8-9 a.m. A-G: noon to 1 p.m.
H-O: 9-10 a.m. H-O: 1-2 p.m.
P-Z: 10-11 a.m. P-Z: 2-3 p.m.
Makeup time: 11-Noon Makeup time: 3-4 p.m.
Please remember that distance learning is looking a little different for every student, family and teacher. We are establishing our routines just as you are at home. Staff will continue to reach out to students in multiple ways. Paper packets will continue to be mailed out to supplement learning. Staff will use communication methods to meet the needs of students and lessons as we build and implement ‚Äì and evaluate ‚Äì our distance learning plan.
Thank you for your continued grace and understanding to us, to each other, and to yourselves. Nothing about this is easy as we build a new way of teaching - a new way of learning. But it will get easier. And we are glad to do it. We are Central. And we believe in the whole child -- social, emotional and academic learning and success. Please continue to stay safe, healthy, and maintain social distance (6 feet apart).



Actualizaci√≥n sobre el aprendizaje a distancia y el cierre de escuelas
24 de abril del 2020
Familias del Distrito Escolar Central,

Estamos terminando una semana de aprendizaje en l√≠nea para los estudiantes y el personal
de la Escuela Preparatoria Central (CHS), y estamos haciendo ajustes a medida que avanzamos para que sea la mejor experiencia para todos. Siguiendo la gu√≠a del Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n (ODE), los estudiantes en los grados 9-11 recibir√°n un pase/incompleto en lugar de una calificaci√≥n en grado para los trimestres 3 y 4. Para aliviar la ansiedad sobre las calificaciones, la boleta de calificaciones en l√≠nea, se desactivar√° a la vista de alumnos y padres. Busque m√°s informaci√≥n y orientaci√≥n de los directores de su escuela.
En todos los grados, ODE recomienda no reprobar a los estudiantes. En su lugar, las escuelas trabajar√°n para hacer planes, a medida que comenzamos a mirar hacia el a√±o escolar 2020-21. Por favor sea paciente y tolerante, ya que se compartir√° m√°s informaci√≥n a medida que avancemos.
La directora de CHS, Donna Servignat, organizar√° una charla llamada "Platica con la directora y la clase del 2020" a las 3:30 p.m. el 30 de abril. La pl√°tica ser√° una transmisi√≥n en vivo, filmada en la Universidad del Oeste de Oregon (WOU). Est√© atento a la comunicaci√≥n futura para un enlace a la pl√°tica en vivo.
Mientras tanto, los estudiantes y profesores de la Escuela Secundaria Talmadge comenzar√°n el aprendizaje en l√≠nea a partir del lunes. Aqu√≠ est√° el nuevo directorio de profesores para la escuela media, con enlaces a los sitios de Google de los profesores: https://sites.google.com/central.k12.or.us/tms-dl-directory/home
Recientemente recibimos orientaci√≥n para los estudiantes en los grados K-8 del Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n. Estamos viendo lo que significa exactamente eso para los estudiantes, las familias y el personal, y le haremos saber tan pronto como sea posible.
A medida que nos mudamos a reuniones/aulas virtuales "en vivo" con nuestro personal, queremos hacerle consciente de que estas reuniones "en vivo" de Google ser√°n grabadas para la seguridad de los estudiantes, as√≠ como del personal. Los estudiantes pueden optar por no encender su c√°mara en estas reuniones y seguir asistiendo a clases. Adem√°s, recuerde a sus alumnos que s√≥lo porque no estamos en las aulas, las reglas del aula y la etiqueta todav√≠a se aplican. Favor de abstenerse del lenguaje obsceno y v√≠stase apropiadamente. Los profesores del aula compartir√°n m√°s informaci√≥n y expectativas en estos entornos virtuales del aula en vivo. Por favor, tambi√©n cheque su correo la pr√≥xima semana para m√°s informaci√≥n relacionada con las aulas virtuales en vivo.
Adem√°s, la gobernadora Kate Brown lanz√≥ una nueva orden ejecutiva, el jueves, que puede ofrecer algunas oportunidades nuevas, as√≠ como desaf√≠os, a medida que seguimos avanzando. Para el impacto inmediato, sabemos que la orden ahora se extiende hasta el 30 de junio. Lo actualizaremos como vallamos sabiendo m√°s informaci√≥n.
¬°A la Escuela Secundaria de Talmadge le fue muy bien con el proceso de recoger las computadoras Chromebook y los art√≠culos esenciales - gracias a todos los que ayudaron a hacer que el proceso no tuviera problemas! Estamos trabajando en una forma de garantizar que cualquier estudiante que se haya perdido los d√≠as asignados para recoger una computadora Chromebook, as√≠ como aquellos que todav√≠a tienen art√≠culos personales en las escuelas, a√∫n puedan obtener lo que necesitan.
El d√≠a para recoger las computadoras Chromebook para estudiantes de la escuela primaria comienza el lunes a las 8 a.m. para los estudiantes de quinto grado y para los estudiantes de cuarto grado, al mediod√≠a del lunes. El martes para los alumnos de tercer grado, comienza a las 8 a.m., seguido por el segundo grado al mediod√≠a. El mi√©rcoles para los alumnos de primer grado est√° programado a las 8 a.m. y para los ni√±os de k√≠nder al mediod√≠a. Todas las computadoras de Chromebook ser√°n recogidas en la Preparatoria Central (CHS).

Para evitar largas filas y mantener el distanciamiento social, por favor venga de acuerdo con su apellido:

En la Ma√±ana: En la tarde:
¬∑
A-G: 8-9 a.m. A-G: 12p.m. a 1 p.m.
H-O: 9-10 a.m. H-O: 1-2 p.m.
P-Z: 10-11 a.m. P-Z: 2-3 p.m.
Horario extra: 11-Noon Horario extra: 3-4 p.m.

Recuerde que el aprendizaje a distancia se ve un poco diferente para cada estudiante, familia y maestro. Estamos estableciendo nuestras rutinas, tal como usted lo est√° haciendo en casa. El personal continuar√° llegando a los estudiantes de m√∫ltiples maneras. Los paquetes en papel continuar√°n siendo enviados por correo para complementar el aprendizaje. El personal utilizar√°
m√©todos de comunicaci√≥n para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes y las lecciones a medida que construimos, implementamos y evaluamos nuestro plan de aprendizaje a distancia.
Gracias por su continua paciencia y comprensi√≥n para nosotros, para los dem√°s y para ustedes mismos. Nada de esto es f√°cil, a medida que construimos una nueva forma de ense√±ar - una nueva forma de aprender. Pero ser√° m√°s f√°cil. Y estamos contentos de hacerlo. Somos parte del Distrito Central. Y creemos en todo el ni√±o: el aprendizaje social, emocional, acad√©mico y el √©xito. Por favor, contin√∫e manteni√©ndose seguro, sano y mantenga la distancia social (6 pies de distancia).

post_text:
If you or someone you know is struggling with mental or emotional health, Polk County Behavioral Health is OPEN and providing all services through TELEHEALTH (Video/phone), starting with phone registration and scheduling for services. (Buildings are closed due to COVID-19 with few exceptions).

Everything for Central Health and Wellness mental health services as well as our other mental health services for youth and families is available by phone registration and will be set up to happen by video (Hangout Meet). It is confidential and safely provided to the individual in their home.

https://www.co.polk.or.us/bh/video-appointments

Ms. Wendy writes: Most of my #quarantine time has been spent creating awesome #distancelearning material. However, when I do have time to myself I work with my family in the garden and with our baby chickens.

#CHSSpringFling2020 What are you doing in quarantine? Are you wearing purple? Show us your spirit!
text:
Ms. Wendy writes: Most of my #quarantine time has been spent creating awesome #distancelearning material. However, when I do have time to myself I work with my family in the garden and with our baby chickens.

#CHSSpringFling2020 What are you doing in quarantine? Are you wearing purple? Show us your spirit!

post_text:
Good morning! As we all struggle with emotions during this unprecedented time, it may be good to help teenagers learn to cope with uncomfortable emotions rather than simply coaching them to "stay positive."

According to this article: But there‚Äôs another route we could take that might serve our teenagers better in the long run. We could, at this challenging time, help them make room for uncomfortable emotions. As a psychologist, this strikes me as a worthwhile caregiving effort.

If students are struggling, Central School District and its partners have counselors ready to help.

Read more:

post_text:
Central School District Families,
A big thank youll for your amazing patience and grace as we all work through these unprecedented times together! We are all pieces in the puzzle as Central rolls out the third pillar of the Distance Learning for All plan: Teacher-Led Learning.

Central High School students have been online with teachers this week, working in Google Classrooms. Teachers‚Äô Google sites are open, so parents may check in and see contact information, as well as office hours. Each school will have a directory for easy access. Here is Central High School‚Äôs Google site directory: https://sites.google.com/central.k12.or.us/chs-dl-directory/home
It is important to remind students to abide by the expectations we have in schools, even when we are distance learning. Schools will continue to follow up about expectations in this new learning environment. Please remind your student to refrain from profanity, dress appropriately, and to put themselves in a positive learning environment in your home as much as possible.

Talmadge Middle School students are wrapping up Chromebook checkout and essential items pick-up this week (Wednesday for sixth-graders), and will be online as soon as April 27.

Elementary school students are picking up essential items this week, with Kinders (8-10 a.m.) and fifth grade (noon to 2 p.m.) Wednesday, April 22; first (8-10 a.m.) and fourth (noon to 2 p.m.) on Thursday, April 23; and second (8-10 a.m.) and third (noon to 2 p.m.) on Friday, April 24. Please remember to maintain social distance when you go to pick up items! We miss you. We are happy to see you. But we cannot hug you, or high five with you right now. We need to maintain safety and security for all during this time and know that hugs and high fives will be in smiles, waves and excitement in just getting to see you.

Starting April 27, the elementary schools will begin Chromebook checkout at Central High School:
Monday: fifth (8-noon) and fourth (noon to 4)
Tuesday: third (8-noon) and second (noon to 4)
Wednesday: first (8-noon) and kinders (noon to 4)

To avoid long lines and maintain social distancing, please come according to the your last name:
Mornings: Afternoons:
A-G: 8-9 a.m. A-G: noon to 1 p.m.
H-O: 9-10 a.m. H-O: 1-2 p.m.
P-Z: 10-11 a.m. P-Z: 2-3 p.m.
Makeup time: 11-Noon Makeup time: 3-4 p.m.

As you log on, remember Teacher-Led learning is one pillar of the three. Don‚Äôt forget to look for the supplemental activities in the mail and take advantage of our meal programs.

Also, our tech team is ready to help. If you need help resetting your password or getting your student ID, please leave a message at (503) 606-2265. When you call, please provide the following information: student first and last name and if possible, student identification (ID) number; school; and grade level.

On a community note, The 2020 Census is wrapping up soon. Help us secure our communities‚Äô share of federal funding for the next decade by helping ‚Äúget out the count.‚Äù If you haven‚Äôt received a paper questionnaire or in invitation to respond by mail, you probably won‚Äôt get one, according to the U.S. Census Bureau. You can still be counted at my2020census.gov, or over the phone, 1-844-330-2020 for English; 1-844-468-2020 for Spanish. This is important for our community and our future.

Remember that staff will continue to reach out to students in multiple ways. This could include by phone, email, Google Meets, apps (i.e. Remind) and old-fashioned postcards or notes. This may look different from teacher to teacher, building to building, and day to day. They will use communication to meet the needs of the students and the lessons as we build and implement our distance learning.

Please continue to extend grace and understanding to us, to each other, and to yourselves. Nothing about this is easy as we build a new way of teaching - a new way of learning. But it will get easier. And we are glad to do it. We are Central. And we believe in the whole child -- social, emotional and academic learning and success. Please continue to stay safe, healthy, and maintain social distance (6 feet apart).

Queridas familias del Distrito Central,
¬°Un gran agradecimiento a todos por su incre√≠ble paciencia y gracia, ya que todos trabajamos a trav√©s de estos tiempos sin precedentes juntos! Todos somos piezas en el rompecabezas a medida que Central despliega el tercer pilar del plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos: Aprendizaje dirigido por el profesor.
Los estudiantes de la Escuela Secundaria Central han estado en l√≠nea con los profesores esta semana, trabajando en las aulas de Google. Los sitios de Google de los profesores est√°n abiertos, por lo que los padres pueden registrarse y ver la informaci√≥n de contacto, as√≠ como el horario de oficina. Cada escuela tendr√° un directorio para facilitar el acceso. Aqu√≠ est√° el directorio del sitio de Google de la Preparatoria Central:https://sites.google.com/central.k12.or.us/chs-dl-directory/home
Es importante recordar a los estudiantes que cumplan con las expectativas que tenemos en las escuelas, incluso cuando estamos aprendiendo a distancia. Las escuelas seguir√°n haciendo un seguimiento de las expectativas en este nuevo entorno de aprendizaje. Por favor, recuerde a su estudiante que se abstenga de decir groser√≠as, se vista apropiadamente y que se ponga en un ambiente de aprendizaje positivo en su hogar tanto como sea posible.
Los estudiantes de la SecundariaTalmadge est√°n terminando de recoger las computadoras Chromebook y de recoger los art√≠culos esenciales esta semana (mi√©rcoles para estudiantes de sexto grado), y estar√°n en l√≠nea tan pronto como el 27 de abril.
Los estudiantes de la escuela primaria est√°n recogiendo art√≠culos esenciales esta semana, comenzando con los de K√≠nder (8-10 a.m.) y quinto grado (mediod√≠a a 2 p.m.) mi√©rcoles 22 de abril; primero grado (8-10 a.m.) y cuarto grado (mediod√≠a a 2 p.m.) el jueves 23 de abril; y segundo grado (8-10 a.m.) y tercero grado (mediod√≠a a 2 p.m.) el viernes 24 de abril. ¬°Por favor, recuerde mantener la distancia social cuando vaya a recoger art√≠culos! Te extra√±amos. Estamos felices de verte. Pero no podemos abrazarte, o darte la mano por ahora. Tenemos que mantener la seguridad para todos durante este tiempo y saber que los abrazos y saludos de mano se dan en sonrisas, olas y emoci√≥n al llegar a verte.
A partir del 27 de abril, las escuelas primarias comenzar√°n a prestar las computadoras Chromebook en la Preparatoria Central:
Lunes: quinto grado (8-mediod√≠a) y cuarto grado (mediod√≠a a 4)
Martes: tercer grado (8-mediod√≠a) y segundo grado (mediod√≠a a 4)
Mi√©rcoles: primero grado (8-mediod√≠a) y amables (mediod√≠a a 4)

Para evitar largas filas y mantener el distanciamiento social, por favor venga de acuerdo con su apellido:

H-O: 9-10 a.m. H-O: 1-2 p.m.
P-Z: 10-11 a.m. P-Z: 2-3 p.m.
Horario extra: 11-12p.m. Horario extra: 3-4 p.m.
Al iniciar sesi√≥n, recuerde que el aprendizaje dirigido por el maestro es uno de tres. No se olvide de buscar las actividades suplementarias en el correo y aprovechar nuestros programas de comidas.
Adem√°s, nuestro equipo t√©cnico est√° listo para ayudar. Si necesita ayuda para restablecer su contrase√±a u obtener su identificaci√≥n de estudiante, por favor deje un mensaje al (503) 606-2265. Cuando llame, proporcione la siguiente informaci√≥n: nombre y apellidos del estudiante y, si es posible, n√∫mero de identificaci√≥n del estudiante (ID); escuela; y nivel de grado.
Por otra parte, hay una nota de la comunidad. El Censo del 2020 se est√° terminando pronto. Ay√∫denos a asegurar la participaci√≥n de nuestras comunidades en los fondos federales para la pr√≥xima d√©cada ayudando a "completar la encuesta". Si no ha recibido un cuestionario en papel o en invitaci√≥n para responder por correo, probablemente no recibir√° uno, seg√∫n la Oficina del Censo de los Estados Unidos. Todav√≠a se puede hacer contar en my2020census.gov, o por tel√©fono, 1-844-330-2020 para ingl√©s; 1-844-468-2020 para espa√±ol. Esto es importante para nuestra comunidad y nuestro futuro.
Recuerde que el personal continuar√° comunic√°ndose con los estudiantes de m√∫ltiples maneras. Esto podr√≠a incluir por tel√©fono, correo electr√≥nico, Google Meets, aplicaciones como por ejemplo Remind y tarjetas postales o cartas. Esto puede depender seg√∫n el maestro, la escuela y del d√≠a. Utilizar√°n la comunicaci√≥n para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes y las lecciones a medida que construimos e implementamos nuestro aprendizaje a distancia.
Por favor, contin√∫en extendiendo la gracia y la comprensi√≥n, los unos a los otros y a ustedes mismos. Nada de esto es f√°cil a medida que construimos una nueva forma de ense√±ar - una nueva forma de aprender. Pero ser√° m√°s f√°cil. Y estamos contentos de hacerlo. Todos somos parte del Distrito Central. Y creemos en todo el ni√±o: el aprendizaje social, emocional y acad√©mico y el √©xito. Por favor, contin√∫e estando seguro, saludable y mantenga la distancia social (6 pies de distancia).

post_text: Elementary schools will begin their pickup process tomorrow! See below for more details, including times and a map.
shared_text:
Ash Creek Elementary School
April 21 at 7:30 PM ¬∑

Good Afternoon Ash Creek Families,

Tomorrow we will begin our student belonging pick-up process. ü¶Ö

Wednesday 4/22:
Kindergarten: 8-10 am
5th grade: 12-2 pm

Thursday 4/23:
1st grade: 8-10 am
4th grade: 12-2 pm

Friday 4/24:
2nd grade: 8-10 am
3rd grade: 12-2 pm

Families that have multiple students are invited to come during any of their child‚Äôs pick-up blocks to collect their students‚Äô belongings. We will have siblings grouped together with the youngest siblings' belongings.

Please carefully read through the following information to ensure that social distancing guidelines are followed in order to keep our families and staff safe.

Cars - Please enter through the north parking lot entrance and proceed to the front of the building. You will be greeted by a staff member from the passenger side window who will give you directions. Please be ready to provide your child‚Äôs name, grade and classroom teacher‚Äôs name. All belongings will be brought to you as you remain in your cars.

Walk-Up Line - Please enter the Ash Creek campus using the sidewalk at the south end of the campus. The line will begin on the sidewalk along the bus loop. The sidewalk along the northeast front of the building will be reserved for Ash Creek staff assisting families in cars. Social distancing markers will be identified for people to use while waiting in line. **After collecting your child‚Äôs belongings, please follow the route back down through the bus loop towards 16th Street.

Please Note:
The sidewalk along the northeast front of the building will be closed to the public and only open to Ash Creek staff.
The sidewalk area between the parking lots will be closed to the public and only open to Ash Creek staff.
The bus loop parking lot will be closed to car traffic and only open to families who are walking.

post_text:
Seniors! Don't forget to check your Central emails for information about this exciting opportunity to enroll in a FREE, accelerated five-week course at Chemeketa Community College!

Chemeketa BOLT Program - Free College Course Opportunity

CHS Seniors,

Chemeketa is offering graduated senior students in the Mid-Willamette Valley access to a FREE - tuition, fees, textbooks - accelerated 5-week course starting May 4.

Eligible students will have the opportunity to jumpstart their academic careers and goals, connecting online with faculty from Chemeketa Community College.

This program is FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED...with only 35 students being allowed to enroll for each course offering.

Program Requirements:
Senior who has met graduation requirements from Central High School
Student has DAILY access to a LAPTOP
Student has DAILY access to WIFI

If you have NOT taken a College Credit Now course from CCC while at Central HS, please apply for admission to College Credit Now ASAP from the link below (you will need to do this to be able to apply for the program):

https://ssb.chemeketa.edu/PBAN/f?p=901:1:15152366348274:::::

Questions?

Please email:
jcentoni@central.k12.or.us
Forgot your CCC Information?

Call Chemeketa IT Help Desk:
503.399.7899
Go Panthers!!!
Jeff Centoni
CTE Program Coordinator
Central School District
jcentoni@central.k12.or.us

Students and families of MES, IES, and ACES! The elementary schools now have a plan for students to retrieve their personal items from their school!

Your student‚Äôs teacher will be contacting you to let you know if your child has items that were left at school. We are asking families to follow an item retrieval schedule to continue with the recommendation of social distancing. The following times are when families can pick up student‚Äôs personal items. If you have multiple students at different grade levels, you may wait to pick up all items at the last scheduled time for your students. As always, we are taking safety precautions when bagging up student materials, and during distribution.

**Each school will communicate their specific distribution plan for cars and for a walk up line.

Wednesday, April 22nd
Kindergarten 8 -10 am
Fifth Grade 12 - 2 pm
Thursday, April 23rd
First Grade 8 -10 am
Fourth Grade 12 - 2 pm
Friday, April 24th
Second Grade 8 -10 am
Third Grade 12 - 2 pm

Si tiene varios alumnos en diferentes niveles de grado, puede esperar a recoger todos los art√≠culos en el √∫ltimo horario programado para sus alumnos. Como siempre, estamos tomando precauciones de seguridad al momento de guardar los art√≠culos del alumno y durante la distribuci√≥n.

** Cada escuela comunicar√° su plan de distribuci√≥n espec√≠fico para las filas de autom√≥viles y de personas que van caminando.

As always, we are taking safety precautions when bagging up student materials, and during distribution.

**Each school will communicate their specific distribution plan for cars and for a walk up line.

post_text:
Central School District Families,
Today, parents of Talmadge students should have received more details in the mail about picking up Chromebooks and essential items from lockers or the band room. The process will start Monday with eighth grade, and be followed Tuesday by seventh, and Wednesday by sixth. Chromes will go to elementary students starting April 27.

We know many of you are concerned about picking up ‚Äúnonessential‚Äù items from lockers, as well as athletic equipment. Our safety and security team is working hard with our logistics team to determine the safest way to return all items to students as quickly as we can. Meanwhile, our focus continues on essential items only at this time.

Elementary school teachers will be contacting parents of elementary school students who have left personal belongings in their classrooms. Students will be able to begin collecting their items next Wednesday, Thursday and Friday, April 22-24. Be watching for that phone call/communication from your elementary building principal about belongings and Chromebook pickups.

Starting Monday, high school students will be able to start jumping into Google Classrooms! Our CHS teachers have been hard at work setting up and designing these virtual classrooms. Eligible seniors will have received an email from the high school about a new program with our partner Chemeketa Community College called BOLT. If you have a senior, please be sure to have them check their email for information on this FREE opportunity. (Yes! We said FREE!) Talmadge and the elementary schools will continue to send packets to students that will include some review, new material, as well as social-emotional learning, PE, music and art.

The district expects to receive its Kajeet hot spots soon. That, coupled with some creative problem solving from our technology committee and a partnership with Chemeketa Community College, Central students and families will have 16-17 access points for WiFi available to them in coming weeks. The district continues to review where the best locations of the hot spots will be across the community based on information we have and continue to receive from families about connectivity.

Remember that staff will continue to reach out to students in multiple ways. This could include by phone, email, Google Meets, apps (i.e. Remind) and old-fashioned postcards or notes. This may look different from teacher to teacher, building to building, and day to day. They will use communication to meet the needs of the students and the lessons as we build and implement our distance learning.

Please continue to extend grace and understanding to us, to each other, and to yourselves. Nothing about this is easy as we build a new way of teaching - a new way of learning. But it will get easier. And we are glad to do it. Please continue to stay safe, healthy, and maintain social distance (6 feet apart).

Familias del Distrito Escolar Central,
Hoy en d√≠a, los padres de los estudiantes de Talmadge deber√≠an haber recibido m√°s detalles en el correo sobre recoger las computadoras Chromebooks y art√≠culos esenciales de los casilleros o el aula de m√∫sica. El proceso comenzar√° el lunes con octavo grado, y ser√° seguido el martes por s√©ptimo, y el mi√©rcoles por sexto. Las computadoras Chromebooks ir√°n a los estudiantes de primaria a partir del 27 de abril.
Sabemos que muchos de ustedes est√°n preocupados por recoger art√≠culos "no esenciales" de los casilleros, as√≠ como equipos deportivos. Nuestro equipo de seguridad est√° trabajando duro con nuestro equipo de log√≠stica para determinar la forma m√°s segura de devolver todos los art√≠culos a los estudiantes tan r√°pido como podamos. Mientras tanto, nuestro enfoque contin√∫a en los elementos esenciales s√≥lo en este momento.
Los maestros de la escuela primaria se pondr√°n en contacto con los padres de los estudiantes de la escuela primaria que han dejado sus pertenencias personales en sus aulas. Los estudiantes podr√°n comenzar a recoger sus art√≠culos el pr√≥ximo mi√©rcoles, jueves y viernes, del 22 al 24 de abril. Est√© atento a esa llamada telef√≥nica / comunicaci√≥n del director de la escuela acerca de c√≥mo recoger las pertenencias y computadoras Chromebook.
¬°A partir del lunes, los estudiantes de secundaria podr√°n empezar a usar las aulas virtuales de Google! Nuestros profesores de CHS han estado trabajando arduamente en la creaci√≥n y el dise√±o de estas aulas virtuales. Los alumnos del doceavo grado elegibles habr√°n recibido un correo electr√≥nico de la escuela secundaria sobre un nuevo programa con nuestro socio el Colegio Comunitario de Chemeketa llamado BOLT. Si usted tiene un estudiante del doceavo grado, por favor aseg√∫rese de que revisen su correo electr√≥nico para obtener informaci√≥n sobre esta oportunidad GRATUITA. (¬°S√≠! ¬°Dijimos GRATIS!) Talmadge y las escuelas primarias continuar√°n enviando paquetes a los estudiantes que incluir√°n alguna revisi√≥n, nuevo material, as√≠ como aprendizaje socioemocional, educaci√≥n f√≠sica, m√∫sica y arte.
El distrito espera recibir acceso a puntos de internet Kajeet pronto. Eso, junto con algunos problemas creativos de resoluci√≥n de problemas de nuestro comit√© de tecnolog√≠a y una asociaci√≥n con el Colegio Comunitario Chemeketa, los estudiantes y familias de Central tendr√°n 16-17 puntos de acceso para WiFi disponibles para ellos en las pr√≥ximas semanas. El distrito contin√∫a revisando d√≥nde las mejores ubicaciones de los puntos calientes estar√°n en toda la comunidad en funci√≥n de la informaci√≥n que tenemos y contin√∫an recibiendo de las familias sobre la conectividad.
Recuerde que el personal continuar√° llegando a los estudiantes de m√∫ltiples maneras. Esto podr√≠a incluir por tel√©fono, correo electr√≥nico, Google Meets, aplicaciones (ej. Recordar) y tarjetas postales o notas. Esto puede variar depende de maestro a maestro, de escuela a escuela y d√≠a a d√≠a. Utilizar√°n la comunicaci√≥n para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes y las lecciones a medida que construimos e implementamos nuestro aprendizaje a distancia.
Por favor, contin√∫en extendi√©ndonos la gracia y la comprensi√≥n, los unos a los otros y a ustedes mismos. Nada de esto es f√°cil a medida que construimos una nueva forma de ense√±ar - una nueva forma de aprender. Pero ser√° m√°s f√°cil. Y estamos contentos de hacerlo. Por favor, contin√∫e manteni√©ndose seguro, sano y mantenga la distancia social (6 pies de distancia).

UPDATE: Students will have to access the Google form from their student email.

Did we say FREE? Yes. Yes we did. Read below to learn how seniors may qualify for a free, accelerated college course starting May 4!

Chemeketa BOLT Program - Free College Course Opportunity

CHS Seniors,

Chemeketa is offering graduated senior students in the Mid-Willamette Valley access to a FREE - tuition, fees, textbooks - accelerated 5-week course starting May 4.

Eligible students will have the opportunity to jumpstart their academic careers and goals, connecting online with faculty from Chemeketa Community College.

This program is FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED...with only 35 students being allowed to enroll for each course offering.

Program Requirements:
Senior who has met graduation requirements from Central High School
Student has DAILY access to a LAPTOP
Student has DAILY access to WIFI
Interested students should fill out the following GOOGLE FORM as soon as possible:

https://forms.gle/LuWZn8Kx6sMdTVp38

If you have NOT taken a College Credit Now course from CCC while at Central HS, please apply for admission to College Credit Now ASAP from the link below (you will need to do this to be able to apply for the program):

https://ssb.chemeketa.edu/PBAN/f?p=901:1:15152366348274:::::

Questions?

Please email:
jcentoni@central.k12.or.us
Forgot your CCC Information?

Call Chemeketa IT Help Desk:
503.399.7899
Go Panthers!!!
Jeff Centoni
CTE Program Coordinator
Central School District
jcentoni@central.k12.or.us

Freshmen! It's your day to pick up Chromebooks! See details below:

Chromebook checkout for Central High School freshmen will be held today, April 15th, from noon to 4 p.m.
As much as possible, please come during your scheduled time to avoid long waiting in lines:
Last name A-G: Noon to 1 p.m.
H-O: 1 to 2 p.m.
P-Z: 2 to 3 p.m.
Makeup time: 3 to 4 p.m.

This will be a time for students to collect essential personal belongings from their lockers or an instrument that belongs to them from the band room. If your student needs to collect something, let us know when you pick up your chromebook, and we will provide a way for them to access their belongings.

El pr√©stamo de Chromebooks para los estudiantes del grado 9 el 15 de abril desde el mediod√≠a hasta las 4 p.m.
En la medida que le sea posible, por favor venga durante su tiempo programado para evitar larga espera en la fila:
Apellido A-G: 12 p.m. a 1 p.m.
Apellido H-O: 1 a 2 p.m.
Apellido P-Z: 2 a 3 p.m.
Horario extra: 3 a 4 p.m.
Este ser√° un buen momento para que los estudiantes recojan pertenencias esenciales de sus casilleros o un instrumento que les pertenezca del aula de banda. Si su estudiante necesita recoger algo, av√≠senos cuando recoja su chromebook, y le proporcionaremos una forma de acceder a sus pertenencias.

post_text: Today is the day! Chromebooks and essential items may be picked up by seniors today starting at noon. Read the full post below for details.
shared_text:
Central School District 13J
April 8 at 3:54 PM ¬∑

Central High School Families,
We have been working diligently at putting together a plan for distance learning. As part of the plan we will begin distributing Chrome books to Panther seniors and juniors, starting Thursday, April 9, and continuing Friday, April 10.

Chromebook checkout for seniors will be held on April 9 from noon to 4 p.m. Juniors can pick theirs up April 10 from noon to 4 p.m. Next week, we will checkout chromebooks to sophomores on April 14 and to freshmen on April 15.

As much as possible, please come during your scheduled time to avoid long waiting in lines:
Last name A-G: Noon to 1 p.m.
Last name H-O: 1 to 2 p.m.
Last name P-Z: 2 to 3 p.m.
Makeup time: 3 to 4 p.m.

To avoid backup on Monmouth Street, please follow the map enclosed. Pickup will be in the EAST parking lot.

This will be a time for students to collect essential belongings from their lockers or an instrument that belongs to them from the band room. If your student needs to collect something, let us know when you pick up your chromebook, and we will provide a way for them to access their belongings.
(To maintain safety amid Covid-19 restrictions, staff will retrieve the item. No students are being allowed in the building at this time.)

Please follow the loop on the map provided.

Walk-up traffic: Please form a line and wait on a Blue X to maintain social distancing.

Questions? Give us a call at (503) 606-2214.

Familias de la Preparatoria Central,

Hemos estado trabajando diligentemente en la elaboraci√≥n de un plan para el aprendizaje a distancia. Como parte del plan, comenzaremos a prestar computadoras Chrome a los estudiantes de los grados 11 y 12 a partir del jueves 9 de abril y continuando el viernes 10 de abril del 2020.

El pr√©stamo de Chromebooks para los estudiantes del grado 12 se llevar√° a cabo el 9 de abril desde el mediod√≠a hasta las 4 p.m. Los estudiantes del grado 11 pueden recoger el suyo el 10 de abril desde el mediod√≠a hasta las 4 p.m. La pr√≥xima semana, prestaremos los chromebooks a los estudiantes del grado 10, el 14 de abril y a los estudiantes del grado 9 el 15 de abril.

En la medida que le sea posible, por favor venga durante su tiempo programado para evitar larga espera en las filas:

Apellido A-G: 12 p.m. a 1 p.m.
Apellido H-O: 1 a 2 p.m.
Apellido P-Z: 2 a 3 p.m.
Horario extra: 3 a 4 p.m.

Para evitar tr√°fico en la calle Monmouth, por favor siga el mapa adjunto. Favor de recoger a los estudiantes en el estacionamiento del lado ESTE del edificio.

Este ser√° un buen momento para que los estudiantes recojan pertenencias esenciales de sus casilleros o un instrumento que les pertenezca del aula de banda. Si su estudiante necesita recoger algo, av√≠senos cuando recoja su chromebook, y le proporcionaremos una forma de acceder a sus pertenencias. Para mantener la seguridad en medio de las restricciones de Covid-19, el personal recuperar√° el art√≠culo. No se permite la entrada de estudiantes en el edificio en este momento.

Por favor, siga la glorieta como se muestra en el mapa proporcionado.

Para personas caminando: Por favor, forme una l√≠nea y espere en la X azul para mantener el distanciamiento social.

¬øPreguntas? Ll√°menos al (503) 606-2214.

In honor of our students we will be joining with other schools across the nation in the ‚ÄúBe The Light Movement‚Äù by turning our stadium lights on as a symbol of hope and support for all Central School District 13J students.

We want all of our students to know how important they are to us and that we care for each and every one of them.

The lights will come on each school night at 8:20pm and will light up the stadium for one minute for each school day lost during this pandemic.

To our students, you are missed greatly and on our hearts and minds.
#BetheLight

En honor a nuestros estudiantes nos uniremos a otras escuelas de todo el pa√≠s en el movimiento " Se la Luz " encendiendo las luces de nuestro estadio como s√≠mbolo de esperanza y apoyo para todos los estudiantes del Distrito Escolar Central 13J.

Queremos que todos nuestros estudiantes sepan lo importantes que son para nosotros y lo mucho que nos importan todos y cada uno de ellos.

Las luces de la escuela se encender√°n cada noche a las 8:20 p.m. e iluminar√°n el estadio durante un minuto por cada d√≠a escolar perdido durante esta pandemia.
Para nuestros alumnos, se les echa mucho de menos en nuestros corazones y mentes.

#BetheLight
