post_text:
UPDATE: This post has been updated to reflect the change to Passwords.
Dear Families of Central School District 13J,
Today, we got the news from Gov. Kate Brown that in-person learning would not commence for the remainder of this school year.

Today's news was difficult to hear, but I know our students, staff, and community are strong and resilient as we work through these unprecedented times. We will continue to reach out to students and families to support them socially and emotionally, as well as through student meals, while we continue moving forward with our Distance Learning for All plan.

We also learned that high school seniors who were on track to graduate prior to the statewide school closure will receive a passing grade. The governor stressed that our seniors would not be punished for missing two months of school out of the 12 years and 7 months they‚Äôve attended classes. For those who do not have a passing grade as of mid-March, the district will focus its efforts to get these seniors any extra attention they need to get them across the finish line. Central High School counseling team will be calling all seniors and families to talk to them about their status in the coming days after we have had an opportunity to review transcripts under the new guidance from the Oregon Department of Education that was released at 1:30pm to all school districts in Oregon, said Central High School Principal Donna Servignat.

We will continue to develop ways to celebrate our Class of 2020, with the input of students, staff and our community at large.

‚ÄúNone of us expected the school year to turn out like this,‚Äù said Adrienne Gault, CEA president and Talmadge Middle School teacher. ‚ÄúIt is challenging for everyone involved. Teachers want to connect with their students in order to help them with all of the uncertainty and further their learning as best as we can. We will be doing that differently from now through June.‚Äù

While we all take time to process this new information, please know that Central teachers, administrators and classified staff are diligently working on a plan to continue educating and supporting each and every one of our students.
‚ÄúThese incredible circumstances don‚Äôt change our mission, just our approach,‚Äù said Colt Gill, Deputy Superintendent of Public Instruction. ‚ÄúThrough Distance Learning for All we will continue to:
First connect with our students and families;
Then understand their physical needs for food, shelter, clothing;
Then strive to support their social-emotional and mental health needs; and
Then do what we got into this work for and what our children need in these times - ignite young minds in Oregon and prepare them for a bright future.‚Äù
Central School District teachers, administrators and classified staff have been working hard to build the Distance Learning for All plan. The schedule to deploy Chromebooks will start Thursday with seniors, followed by juniors on Friday. If you know your senior is on-track to graduate and was passing all classes as of March 13th, a Chromebook pick-up is not necessary. More information will be released toward the end of the day on Friday about the remaining deployment of Chromebooks for students grades K-10. All students will have their passwords reset to ‚Äústudents‚Äù and will be prompted to change their passwords upon login. Please leave a message at (503) 606-2265 if you need help resetting your password or getting your student ID. When you call, please provide the following information: student first and last name and if possible, student identification (ID) number; school; and grade level.

Supplemental packets for all grade levels with additional academic content were mailed today or will be tomorrow. Elementary school students will be able to pick up supplies Thursday during meal pickups from 10 a.m. to noon. All supplies need to be picked up at the school your child is registered.

We will continue to provide updates and information on our website regarding the COVID-19 virus. Families can also call 211 for information and resources.
I am proud to be a part of our community. I thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community are our highest priority.
Please stay safe, healthy, and practice social distancing.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Central School District 13J

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,
Hoy, recibimos la noticia de la gobernadora Kate Brown de que el aprendizaje en persona no comenzar√≠a por el resto de este a√±o escolar.
Las noticias de hoy fueron dif√≠ciles de escuchar, pero s√© que nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidad son fuertes y resistentes a medida que trabajamos en estos tiempos sin precedentes. Continuaremos contactando a los estudiantes y las familias para apoyarlos social y emocionalmente, as√≠ como a trav√©s de las comidas de los estudiantes, mientras continuamos adelante con nuestro plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos.
Tambi√©n aprendimos que los estudiantes del grado 12 de la Preparatoria Central (CHS) que estaban en camino de graduarse antes del cierre estatal de la escuela, recibir√°n una calificaci√≥n de aprobaci√≥n. La gobernadora subray√≥ que nuestros estudiantes no ser√≠an castigados por faltar dos meses a la escuela de los 12 a√±os y 7 meses que han asistido a clases. Para aquellos que no tienen una calificaci√≥n de aprobaci√≥n a mediados de marzo, el distrito centrar√° sus esfuerzos para dar a estos estudiantes cualquier atenci√≥n adicional que necesiten para llegar a trav√©s de la l√≠nea de meta.
El equipo de consejer√≠a de la Preparatoria Central llamar√° a todos los estudiantes del grado 12 y a sus familias para hablar con ellos sobre su estado en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as despu√©s de que hayamos tenido la oportunidad de revisar sus clases completadas bajo la nueva gu√≠a del Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n que fue lanzado a la 1:30 pm a todos los distritos escolares en Oregon, dijo la Directora de la preparatoria Central, Donna Servignat.
Continuaremos desarrollando formas de celebrar nuestros graduados de la clase del 2020, con la aportaci√≥n de los estudiantes, el personal y nuestra comunidad en general.
"Ninguno de nosotros esperaba que el a√±o escolar resultara as√≠", dijo Adrienne Gault, presidenta de la CEA y profesora de la Escuela Secundaria Talmadge. "Es un reto para todos los involucrados. Los maestros quieren conectarse con sus estudiantes con el fin de ayudarles con toda la incertidumbre y promover su aprendizaje lo mejor que podamos. Lo haremos de manera diferente de ahora a junio".
Mientras todos tomamos tiempo para procesar esta nueva informaci√≥n, por favor sepa que los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado de central est√°n trabajando diligentemente en un plan para continuar educando y apoyando a todos y cada uno de nuestros estudiantes.
"Estas incre√≠bles circunstancias no cambian nuestra misi√≥n, solo nuestro enfoque", dijo Colt Gill, Superintendente Adjunto de Instrucci√≥n P√∫blica. "A trav√©s de la ense√±anza a distancia para todos, continuaremos:
Primero conectados con nuestros estudiantes y familias
Luego entender sus necesidades f√≠sicas de alimentos, refugio, ropa;
Luego esforzarse para apoyar sus necesidades de salud social-emocional y mental; y
Luego hagamos las cosas por las cuales entramos a este trabajo y lo que nuestros hijos necesitan en estos tiempos - encender mentes j√≥venes en Oregon y prepararlos para un futuro brillante ".
Los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado del Distrito Escolar Central han estado trabajando arduamente para construir el plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos. El calendario para implementar el pr√©stamo de computadoras Chromebooks comenzar√° el jueves con los estudiantes del grado 12, seguido por los estudiantes del grado 11 el viernes. Si sabes que tu estudiante del grado 12 estaba al corriente para graduarse y estaba pasando todas las clases a partir del 13 de marzo, no es necesario que recoja una computadora Chromebook. Los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado del Distrito Escolar Central han estado trabajando duro para reunir m√°s informaci√≥n que ser√° dada al final del d√≠a el viernes sobre la implementaci√≥n restante de computadoras Chromebooks para estudiantes de los grados K-10. Todos los estudiantes tendr√°n sus contrase√±as reajustadas a "students" y se les pedir√° que cambien sus contrase√±as al iniciar sesi√≥n. Por favor, deje un mensaje al (503) 606-2265 si necesita ayuda para restablecer su contrase√±a u obtener su identificaci√≥n de estudiante. Cuando llame, proporcione la siguiente informaci√≥n: nombre y apellidos del estudiante y, si es posible, n√∫mero de identificaci√≥n del estudiante (ID); escuela; y nivel de grado.
Los paquetes suplementarios para todos los niveles de grado con contenido acad√©mico adicional se enviaron por correo hoy o ser√°n enviados ma√±ana. Los estudiantes de la escuela primaria podr√°n recoger los art√≠culos el jueves durante el horario para recoger comidas de 10 a.m. a 12 p.m. Todos los art√≠culos deben ser recogidos en la escuela que su hijo est√° registrado.
Continuaremos proporcionando actualizaciones e informaci√≥n en nuestro sitio web con respecto al virus COVID-19. Las familias tambi√©n pueden llamar al 211 para obtener informaci√≥n y recursos.
Estoy orgulloso de ser parte de nuestra comunidad. Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad son nuestra m√°xima prioridad.
Por favor, mant√©ngase seguro, sano y practique el distanciamiento social.

Sinceramente,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendente
Distrito Escolar Central
text:
UPDATE: This post has been updated to reflect the change to Passwords.
Dear Families of Central School District 13J,
Today, we got the news from Gov. Kate Brown that in-person learning would not commence for the remainder of this school year.

Today's news was difficult to hear, but I know our students, staff, and community are strong and resilient as we work through these unprecedented times. We will continue to reach out to students and families to support them socially and emotionally, as well as through student meals, while we continue moving forward with our Distance Learning for All plan.

We also learned that high school seniors who were on track to graduate prior to the statewide school closure will receive a passing grade. The governor stressed that our seniors would not be punished for missing two months of school out of the 12 years and 7 months they‚Äôve attended classes. For those who do not have a passing grade as of mid-March, the district will focus its efforts to get these seniors any extra attention they need to get them across the finish line. Central High School counseling team will be calling all seniors and families to talk to them about their status in the coming days after we have had an opportunity to review transcripts under the new guidance from the Oregon Department of Education that was released at 1:30pm to all school districts in Oregon, said Central High School Principal Donna Servignat.

We will continue to develop ways to celebrate our Class of 2020, with the input of students, staff and our community at large.

‚ÄúNone of us expected the school year to turn out like this,‚Äù said Adrienne Gault, CEA president and Talmadge Middle School teacher. ‚ÄúIt is challenging for everyone involved. Teachers want to connect with their students in order to help them with all of the uncertainty and further their learning as best as we can. We will be doing that differently from now through June.‚Äù

While we all take time to process this new information, please know that Central teachers, administrators and classified staff are diligently working on a plan to continue educating and supporting each and every one of our students.
‚ÄúThese incredible circumstances don‚Äôt change our mission, just our approach,‚Äù said Colt Gill, Deputy Superintendent of Public Instruction. ‚ÄúThrough Distance Learning for All we will continue to:
First connect with our students and families;
Then understand their physical needs for food, shelter, clothing;
Then strive to support their social-emotional and mental health needs; and
Then do what we got into this work for and what our children need in these times - ignite young minds in Oregon and prepare them for a bright future.‚Äù
Central School District teachers, administrators and classified staff have been working hard to build the Distance Learning for All plan. The schedule to deploy Chromebooks will start Thursday with seniors, followed by juniors on Friday. If you know your senior is on-track to graduate and was passing all classes as of March 13th, a Chromebook pick-up is not necessary. More information will be released toward the end of the day on Friday about the remaining deployment of Chromebooks for students grades K-10. All students will have their passwords reset to ‚Äústudents‚Äù and will be prompted to change their passwords upon login. Please leave a message at (503) 606-2265 if you need help resetting your password or getting your student ID. When you call, please provide the following information: student first and last name and if possible, student identification (ID) number; school; and grade level.

Supplemental packets for all grade levels with additional academic content were mailed today or will be tomorrow. Elementary school students will be able to pick up supplies Thursday during meal pickups from 10 a.m. to noon. All supplies need to be picked up at the school your child is registered.

We will continue to provide updates and information on our website regarding the COVID-19 virus. Families can also call 211 for information and resources.
I am proud to be a part of our community. I thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community are our highest priority.
Please stay safe, healthy, and practice social distancing.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Central School District 13J

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central 13J,
Hoy, recibimos la noticia de la gobernadora Kate Brown de que el aprendizaje en persona no comenzar√≠a por el resto de este a√±o escolar.
Las noticias de hoy fueron dif√≠ciles de escuchar, pero s√© que nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidad son fuertes y resistentes a medida que trabajamos en estos tiempos sin precedentes. Continuaremos contactando a los estudiantes y las familias para apoyarlos social y emocionalmente, as√≠ como a trav√©s de las comidas de los estudiantes, mientras continuamos adelante con nuestro plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos.
Tambi√©n aprendimos que los estudiantes del grado 12 de la Preparatoria Central (CHS) que estaban en camino de graduarse antes del cierre estatal de la escuela, recibir√°n una calificaci√≥n de aprobaci√≥n. La gobernadora subray√≥ que nuestros estudiantes no ser√≠an castigados por faltar dos meses a la escuela de los 12 a√±os y 7 meses que han asistido a clases. Para aquellos que no tienen una calificaci√≥n de aprobaci√≥n a mediados de marzo, el distrito centrar√° sus esfuerzos para dar a estos estudiantes cualquier atenci√≥n adicional que necesiten para llegar a trav√©s de la l√≠nea de meta.
El equipo de consejer√≠a de la Preparatoria Central llamar√° a todos los estudiantes del grado 12 y a sus familias para hablar con ellos sobre su estado en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as despu√©s de que hayamos tenido la oportunidad de revisar sus clases completadas bajo la nueva gu√≠a del Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n que fue lanzado a la 1:30 pm a todos los distritos escolares en Oregon, dijo la Directora de la preparatoria Central, Donna Servignat.
Continuaremos desarrollando formas de celebrar nuestros graduados de la clase del 2020, con la aportaci√≥n de los estudiantes, el personal y nuestra comunidad en general.
"Ninguno de nosotros esperaba que el a√±o escolar resultara as√≠", dijo Adrienne Gault, presidenta de la CEA y profesora de la Escuela Secundaria Talmadge. "Es un reto para todos los involucrados. Los maestros quieren conectarse con sus estudiantes con el fin de ayudarles con toda la incertidumbre y promover su aprendizaje lo mejor que podamos. Lo haremos de manera diferente de ahora a junio".
Mientras todos tomamos tiempo para procesar esta nueva informaci√≥n, por favor sepa que los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado de central est√°n trabajando diligentemente en un plan para continuar educando y apoyando a todos y cada uno de nuestros estudiantes.
"Estas incre√≠bles circunstancias no cambian nuestra misi√≥n, solo nuestro enfoque", dijo Colt Gill, Superintendente Adjunto de Instrucci√≥n P√∫blica. "A trav√©s de la ense√±anza a distancia para todos, continuaremos:
Primero conectados con nuestros estudiantes y familias
Luego entender sus necesidades f√≠sicas de alimentos, refugio, ropa;
Luego esforzarse para apoyar sus necesidades de salud social-emocional y mental; y
Luego hagamos las cosas por las cuales entramos a este trabajo y lo que nuestros hijos necesitan en estos tiempos - encender mentes j√≥venes en Oregon y prepararlos para un futuro brillante ".
Los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado del Distrito Escolar Central han estado trabajando arduamente para construir el plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos. El calendario para implementar el pr√©stamo de computadoras Chromebooks comenzar√° el jueves con los estudiantes del grado 12, seguido por los estudiantes del grado 11 el viernes. Si sabes que tu estudiante del grado 12 estaba al corriente para graduarse y estaba pasando todas las clases a partir del 13 de marzo, no es necesario que recoja una computadora Chromebook. Los maestros, administradores y personal clasificado del Distrito Escolar Central han estado trabajando duro para reunir m√°s informaci√≥n que ser√° dada al final del d√≠a el viernes sobre la implementaci√≥n restante de computadoras Chromebooks para estudiantes de los grados K-10. Todos los estudiantes tendr√°n sus contrase√±as reajustadas a "students" y se les pedir√° que cambien sus contrase√±as al iniciar sesi√≥n. Por favor, deje un mensaje al (503) 606-2265 si necesita ayuda para restablecer su contrase√±a u obtener su identificaci√≥n de estudiante. Cuando llame, proporcione la siguiente informaci√≥n: nombre y apellidos del estudiante y, si es posible, n√∫mero de identificaci√≥n del estudiante (ID); escuela; y nivel de grado.
Los paquetes suplementarios para todos los niveles de grado con contenido acad√©mico adicional se enviaron por correo hoy o ser√°n enviados ma√±ana. Los estudiantes de la escuela primaria podr√°n recoger los art√≠culos el jueves durante el horario para recoger comidas de 10 a.m. a 12 p.m. Todos los art√≠culos deben ser recogidos en la escuela que su hijo est√° registrado.
Continuaremos proporcionando actualizaciones e informaci√≥n en nuestro sitio web con respecto al virus COVID-19. Las familias tambi√©n pueden llamar al 211 para obtener informaci√≥n y recursos.
Estoy orgulloso de ser parte de nuestra comunidad. Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad son nuestra m√°xima prioridad.
Por favor, mant√©ngase seguro, sano y practique el distanciamiento social.

Sinceramente,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendente
Distrito Escolar Central

post_text:
Central High School Families,
We have been working diligently at putting together a plan for distance learning. As part of the plan we will begin distributing Chrome books to Panther seniors and juniors, starting Thursday, April 9, and continuing Friday, April 10.

Chromebook checkout for seniors will be held on April 9 from noon to 4 p.m. Juniors can pick theirs up April 10 from noon to 4 p.m. Next week, we will checkout chromebooks to sophomores on April 14 and to freshmen on April 15.

As much as possible, please come during your scheduled time to avoid long waiting in lines:
Last name A-G: Noon to 1 p.m.
Last name H-O: 1 to 2 p.m.
Last name P-Z: 2 to 3 p.m.
Makeup time: 3 to 4 p.m.

To avoid backup on Monmouth Street, please follow the map enclosed. Pickup will be in the EAST parking lot.

This will be a time for students to collect essential belongings from their lockers or an instrument that belongs to them from the band room. If your student needs to collect something, let us know when you pick up your chromebook, and we will provide a way for them to access their belongings.
(To maintain safety amid Covid-19 restrictions, staff will retrieve the item. No students are being allowed in the building at this time.)

Please follow the loop on the map provided.

Walk-up traffic: Please form a line and wait on a Blue X to maintain social distancing.

Questions? Give us a call at (503) 606-2214.

Familias de la Preparatoria Central,

Hemos estado trabajando diligentemente en la elaboraci√≥n de un plan para el aprendizaje a distancia. Como parte del plan, comenzaremos a prestar computadoras Chrome a los estudiantes de los grados 11 y 12 a partir del jueves 9 de abril y continuando el viernes 10 de abril del 2020.

El pr√©stamo de Chromebooks para los estudiantes del grado 12 se llevar√° a cabo el 9 de abril desde el mediod√≠a hasta las 4 p.m. Los estudiantes del grado 11 pueden recoger el suyo el 10 de abril desde el mediod√≠a hasta las 4 p.m. La pr√≥xima semana, prestaremos los chromebooks a los estudiantes del grado 10, el 14 de abril y a los estudiantes del grado 9 el 15 de abril.

En la medida que le sea posible, por favor venga durante su tiempo programado para evitar larga espera en las filas:

Apellido A-G: 12 p.m. a 1 p.m.
Apellido H-O: 1 a 2 p.m.
Apellido P-Z: 2 a 3 p.m.
Horario extra: 3 a 4 p.m.

Para evitar tr√°fico en la calle Monmouth, por favor siga el mapa adjunto. Favor de recoger a los estudiantes en el estacionamiento del lado ESTE del edificio.

Este ser√° un buen momento para que los estudiantes recojan pertenencias esenciales de sus casilleros o un instrumento que les pertenezca del aula de banda. Si su estudiante necesita recoger algo, av√≠senos cuando recoja su chromebook, y le proporcionaremos una forma de acceder a sus pertenencias. Para mantener la seguridad en medio de las restricciones de Covid-19, el personal recuperar√° el art√≠culo. No se permite la entrada de estudiantes en el edificio en este momento.

Por favor, siga la glorieta como se muestra en el mapa proporcionado.

Para personas caminando: Por favor, forme una l√≠nea y espere en la X azul para mantener el distanciamiento social.

¬øPreguntas? Ll√°menos al (503) 606-2214.

Central School District 13J Board of Directors will meet Monday virtually and via telephone at 6:30 p.m. While no general public will be allowed to attend the meeting in person, the board wants to provide a public comment section by accepting questions beforehand.

Get moving with Star Jumps! Jump with your arms and legs spread out like a star. Do 10, then rest and repeat! Before bed, try writing or drawing in a journal. What has your life been like the last week? What is one thing that went well, and one thing you wish you could have gone better?

post_text:
CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
DISTANCE LEARNING PLAN UPDATE
UPDATED APRIL 2, 2020, 7:00pm

Dear Central School District Families:
As we maneuver this unprecedented times, our commitment remains clear: We care about you. We care about your family and the students we serve in Central School District 13J.
Our administrative team, working alongside our classified and licensed leadership, has partnered to develop and implement educational plans to support our students during this closure. Packets are being mailed today. Meanwhile, our team is building distance learning education plans so that we may all follow Gov. Kate Brown‚Äôs orders to Stay Home, Save Lives, and keep education going. The Governor has asked us to have these plans in place by April 13. Educators are beginning to reach out to families and during these phone calls will continue to gather the technology needs of families who have not yet responded to the family survey, as we continue to develop plans that will work for all age groups.
Some parts of the Distance Learning for All plans are already in process with the preparation of chromebooks for deployment to students during the week of April 6th, with a focus on the HS first (i.e. - 12th, 11th, 10th, 9th) and then moving to the other levels. Our goal remains focused on the whole child ‚Äì teaching good academics and social-emotional skills. It is along those lines that you will find in your packets age-appropriate tips for developing and maintaining a routine, which can create normalcy during these uncertain times; tips for managing stress; topics for journaling; tips for talking about COVID-19; as well as some fun tasks and exercises the whole family can do each day of the month. Watch our Facebook page for updates on these daily tasks.
Know that we are working hard to best serve all of our students. We will be constantly communicating our plan, implementing it, evaluating it, and adjusting as necessary.
Information will continue to be shared as further guidance is received from the governor, the Oregon Department of Education, and the Oregon Health Authority.
We will continue to provide updates and information on our website regarding the COVID-19 virus. Families can also call 211 for information and resources.
I am proud to be a part of our community. I thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community are our highest priority.

Distrito Escolar Central 13J
Respuesta a las preocupaciones de salud de la comunidad
Actualizaci√≥n del plan de aprendizaje a distancia
Actualizado el 2 de abril del 2020, 7:00pm

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central:
A medida que maniobramos estos tiempos sin precedentes, nuestro compromiso sigue siendo claro: Nos preocupamos por usted. Nos preocupamos por su familia y los estudiantes a los que servimos en el Distrito Escolar Central 13J.
Nuestro equipo administrativo, que trabaja junto con nuestros l√≠deres clasificados y con licencia, se han asociado para desarrollar e implementar planes educativos para apoyar a nuestros estudiantes durante este cierre. Los paquetes se enviar√°n por correo hoy. Mientras tanto, nuestro equipo est√° construyendo planes de educaci√≥n de aprendizaje a distancia para que todos podamos seguir las √≥rdenes de la gobernadora Kate Brown de quedarse en casa, salvar vidas y mantener la educaci√≥n en marcha. La gobernadora nos ha pedido que tengamos estos planes en vigor antes del 13 de abril. Los educadores est√°n empezando a comunicarse con las familias y durante estas llamadas telef√≥nicas continuar√°n reuniendo las necesidades tecnol√≥gicas de las familias que a√∫n no han respondido a la encuesta familiar, a medida que continuamos desarrollando planes que funcionar√°n para todos los grupos de todas las edades.
Algunas partes de los planes de aprendizaje a distancia para todos ya est√°n en proceso con la preparaci√≥n de chromebooks (computadoras port√°tiles) para su implementaci√≥n a los estudiantes durante la semana del 6 de abril, con un enfoque en la preparatoria primero (es decir, 12, 11, 10, 9o) y luego pasando a los otros niveles. Nuestro objetivo sigue siendo enfocado en todo el ni√±o ‚Äì ense√±ando buenos conocimientos acad√©micos y habilidades socioemocionales. Es a lo largo de esas l√≠neas que usted encontrar√° en sus paquetes consejos apropiados para cada edad para desarrollar y mantener una rutina, que puede crear normalidad durante estos tiempos inciertos; consejos para controlar el estr√©s; temas para escribir; consejos para hablar de COVID-19; as√≠ como algunas tareas divertidas y ejercicios que toda la familia puede hacer todos los d√≠as del mes. Vea nuestra p√°gina de Facebook para obtener actualizaciones sobre estas tareas diarias.
Sepa que estamos trabajando arduamente para servir mejor a todos nuestros estudiantes. Estaremos constantemente comunicando nuestro plan, implement√°ndolo, evalu√°ndolo y ajust√°ndolo seg√∫n sea necesario
La informaci√≥n continuar√° comparti√©ndose a medida que se reciban nuevas √≥rdenes de la gobernadora, el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n y la Autoridad de Salud de Oreg√≥n.
Continuaremos proporcionando actualizaciones e informaci√≥n en nuestro sitio web con respecto al virus COVID-19. Las familias tambi√©n pueden llamar al 211 para obtener informaci√≥n y recursos.
Estoy orgulloso de ser parte de nuestra comunidad. Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad son nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

post_text:
Dear Central School District Families:
Estimadas familias del Distrito escolar central:

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
NEW DISTANCE LEARNING FOR ALL
UPDATED March 31, 2020, 7:15pm

DISTRITO ESCOLAR CENTRAL 13J
RESPUESTA A LAS PREOCUPACIONES DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD
NUEVO APRENDIZAJE A DISTANCIA PARA TODOS
ACTUALIZADO eL 31 de marzo del 2020, 7:15pm

Dear Central School District Families:

This is an update as we continue to share information as we maneuver through this unprecedented closure.
Last night at 9pm, the district received new guidance from the Oregon Department of Education (ODE) as it relates to building a long-term plan for distance learning for all. This new approach will focus on ensuring care, connection and continuity of learning in Central School District. As a starting point, here is the definition of distance learning as defined by ODE, which will guide our planning as we move forward.

For the purposes of this guidance, distance learning is defined as instruction in which the student and instructor are in different locations. Students engaging in distance learning have access to appropriate educational materials and receive ongoing interaction with their licensed and/or registered teacher(s). It is important to note that distance learning includes multimedia communication and blended learning strategies, not just digital/online learning.

This week, as I shared previously, families will receive supplemental education focused on social emotional learning and building routines as we begin this transition to distance learning for all. Our staff are also working to develop next week‚Äôs supplemental educational plans as we begin to shift toward a new plan of distance learning for all. I also want to be transparent that we are still waiting for guidance as it relates to seniors and grades 9-11. We believe this guidance will come sometime this week.

Please know we are working hard and building learning to best serve all of our students, which continues to shift every few days - this guidance could shift again. We continue to ask families to be patient with us as we are building as fast as we can for the short-term and long-term approaches that are evolving.

We want to continue to remind families to stay safe, wash your hands, and continue to practice social distancing (6 feet apart).

I thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

Sincerely,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Central School District 13J

Estimadas familias del Distrito escolar central:

Esta es una actualizaci√≥n, a medida que continuamos maniobrando y compartiendo informaci√≥n de este cierre sin precedentes.

Anoche a las 9pm, el distrito recibi√≥ nuevas gu√≠as del Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n (ODE) en lo que se refiere a la construcci√≥n de un plan a largo plazo para el aprendizaje a distancia para todos. Este nuevo enfoque se centrar√° en garantizar la atenci√≥n, la conexi√≥n y la continuidad del aprendizaje en el Distrito Escolar Central. Como punto de partida, aqu√≠ est√° la definici√≥n de aprendizaje a distancia seg√∫n lo definido por ODE, que guiar√° nuestra planificaci√≥n a medida que avanzamos.

Para los efectos de esta gu√≠a, el aprendizaje a distancia se define como instrucci√≥n en la que el alumno y el instructor se encuentran en diferentes ubicaciones. Los estudiantes que participan en el aprendizaje a distancia tienen acceso a materiales educativos apropiados y reciben interacci√≥n continua con maestros con licencia y/o registrados. Es importante tener en cuenta que el aprendizaje a distancia incluye comunicaci√≥n multimedia y estrategias de aprendizaje mixto, no solo aprendizaje digital/en l√≠nea.

Esta semana, como compart√≠ anteriormente, las familias recibir√°n educaci√≥n suplementaria centrada en el aprendizaje emocional, social y la construcci√≥n de rutinas, a medida que comenzamos esta transici√≥n al aprendizaje a distancia para todos. Nuestro personal tambi√©n est√° trabajando para desarrollar los planes educativos suplementarios de la pr√≥xima semana; a medida que comenzamos a cambiar hacia un nuevo plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos. Tambi√©n quiero ser transparente de que todav√≠a estamos esperando orientaci√≥n en lo que se refiere a los j√≥venes que est√°n en su √∫ltimo a√±o de prepa y los grados 9-11. Creemos que esta gu√≠a vendr√° esta semana.

Por favor, sepa que estamos trabajando arduamente y construyendo el aprendizaje para servir mejor a todos nuestros estudiantes, que contin√∫a cambiando cada pocos d√≠as - esta gu√≠a podr√≠a cambiar de nuevo. Seguimos pidiendo a las familias que sean pacientes con nosotros, ya que estamos adapt√°ndonos y trabajando lo m√°s r√°pido posible para los enfoques a corto y largo plazo, que est√°n evolucionando.

Queremos seguir recordando a las familias que se mantengan a salvo, se laven las manos y contin√∫en practicando el distanciamiento social (6 pies de distancia).
Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad es nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

Sinceramente,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendente
Distrito Escolar Central 13J

Esta semana, como compart√≠ anteriormente, las familias recibir√°n educaci√≥n suplementaria centrada en el aprendizaje emocional, social y la construcci√≥n de rutinas, a medida que comenzamos esta transici√≥n al aprendizaje a distancia para todos. Nuestro personal tambi√©n est√° trabajando para desarrollar los planes educativos suplementarios de la pr√≥xima semana; a medida que comenzamos a cambiar hacia un nuevo plan de aprendizaje a distancia para todos. Tambi√©n quiero ser transparente de que todav√≠a estamos esperando orientaci√≥n en lo que se refiere a los j√≥venes que est√°n en su √∫ltimo a√±o de prepa y los grados 9-11. Creemos que esta gu√≠a vendr√° esta semana.

Por favor, sepa que estamos trabajando arduamente y construyendo el aprendizaje para servir mejor a todos nuestros estudiantes, que contin√∫a cambiando cada pocos d√≠as - esta gu√≠a podr√≠a cambiar de nuevo. Seguimos pidiendo a las familias que sean pacientes con nosotros, ya que estamos adapt√°ndonos y trabajando lo m√°s r√°pido posible para los enfoques a corto y largo plazo, que est√°n evolucionando.

Queremos seguir recordando a las familias que se mantengan a salvo, se laven las manos y contin√∫en practicando el distanciamiento social (6 pies de distancia).
Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad es nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

Sinceramente,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendente
Distrito Escolar Central 13J

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
GOVERNOR KATE BROWN EXTENDS STATEWIDE SCHOOL CLOSURE FOR STUDENT IN OREGON THROUGH TUESDAY, APRIL 28
UPDATED March 20, 2020, 6:00pm

DISTRITO ESCOLAR CENTRAL 13J
RESPUESTA A LAS PREOCUPACIONES DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD
LA GOBERNADORA KATE BROWN EXTENDIO EL CIERRE ESCOLAR DEL ESTADO
HASTA EL MARTES, 28 DE ABRIL DEL 2020
ACTUALIZADO el 20 de marzo del 2020, 6:00pm

Dear Central School District Families:
Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central:

I know these are difficult times for Central School District students, families and staff as we maneuver through this unprecedented closure.

Even though things are uncertain, I want you to know our commitment remains clear; we care about you, and we care about your family and the students we serve in Central School District 13J.

Our administrative team, with our classified and licensed leadership, are partnering to develop supplemental educational plans to support our students during this closure.

Meals will continue to be served at all elementary sites and the high school through April 28th between the hours of 10 am - 12 pm. Monday through Friday. The district will also begin bus delivery of meals to students two miles or more outside the cities‚Äô limits, beginning Monday, March 23rd.

Please know we are working hard to best serve all of our students. Information will continue to be shared as further guidance is received from the Governor, the Oregon Department of Education and the Oregon Health Authority.

We will continue to provide updates and information on our website regarding the COVID-19 virus. Families can also call 211 for information and resources.
I am proud to be a part of our community. I thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

Sincerely,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendent
Central School District 13J

Distrito Escolar Central 13J

Respuesta a las preocupaciones de salud de la comunidad
La gobernadora Kate Brown extendi√≥ el cierre escolar del estado hasta el martes, 28 de abril del 2020
Actualizado el 20 de marzo del 2020, 6:00pm

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central:

Aunque las cosas son inciertas, quiero que sepan que nuestro compromiso sigue siendo claro; nos preocupamos por usted, y nos preocupamos por su familia y los estudiantes a los que servimos en el Distrito Escolar Central 13J.

Nuestro equipo administrativo, con nuestro liderazgo clasificado y con licencia, se asocia para desarrollar planes educativos suplementarios para apoyar a nuestros estudiantes durante este cierre.

Las comidas continuar√°n siendo servida en todas las primarias y en la escuela secundaria hasta el 28 de abril entre las 10 am y las 12 pm, de lunes a viernes. El distrito tambi√©n comenzar√° la entrega en autob√∫s de comidas a los estudiantes dos millas o m√°s fuera de los l√≠mites de las ciudades, a partir del lunes 23 de marzo.

Por favor, sepa que estamos trabajando duro para servir mejor a todos nuestros estudiantes. La informaci√≥n continuar√° siendo compartida a medida que se reciban m√°s orientaciones del Gobernador, el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n y la Autoridad de Salud de Oreg√≥n.

Continuaremos proporcionando actualizaciones e informaci√≥n en nuestro sitio web con respecto al virus COVID-19. Las familias tambi√©n pueden llamar al 211 para obtener informaci√≥n y recursos.

Estoy orgulloso de ser parte de nuestra comunidad. Les agradezco su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad es nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

Sinceramente,
Jennifer Kubista, Ed.D.
Superintendente
Distrito Escolar Central 13J

post_text:
Dear Central School District Families:
Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central:

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
STUDENT MEALS DISTRIBUTION DURING CLOSURE
UPDATED March 14, 2020, 3:00pm

DISTRITO ESCOLAR CENTRAL 13J
RESPUESTAS A LAS PREOCUPACIONES
DE LA COMUNIDAD
DISTRIBUCION DE COMIDAS PARA ESTUDIANTES DURANTE EL CIERRE
ACTUALIZACION EL 14 DE MARZO DEL 2020, 3:00 PM

This is an update to share information with families and the community related to student meals during the closure. The district appreciates the community‚Äôs outreach to support this process. However, we have amazing Central Staff who are trained to prepare and deliver student meals during the closure. Should we need additional assistance, please know the district will reach out to the community. Below is information on what our process, generally, will be for the distribution of student meals during the closure.
Student Meal Distribution Plan

‚Ä¢ The district will be serving both breakfast and lunch in sack meal format. Both can be picked up together.
‚Ä¢ One set of meals will be served per day to each child present.
‚Ä¢ Children (aged 1-18) must be present at the time of pick up to receive the meals.
‚Ä¢ Meals will be available for pick up at every building from 10AM to Noon at the designated pick up locations.

Ash Creek Elementary
In front of Ash Creek (bus loop)

Independence Elementary
Northside of the building on B street (cafeteria doors)
Monmouth Elementary
In front of Monmouth (bus loop)

Talmadge Middle School
In front of Talmadge (drop off/pick up area)

Central High School
Eastside of the building by entrance to the Auditorium

Nutrition Services Staff will make sack meals in the kitchens and place them in coolers. To reduce any risk of contamination Nutrition Services cooks will remain in the cafeteria and will not deliver foods directly to the public.

‚Ä¢ We will mark bags with a B (breakfast) or L (Lunch) to differentiate the two meals.
‚Ä¢ We are taking great care to make sure that delivery staff and kitchen staff are practicing their usual excellent food safety and personal hygiene practices to ensure the health of all staff, students, and the community.

‚Ä¢ Staff will ensure one complete set of meals (Breakfast and Lunch) is served for each child present per day.

Principals/District Staff
‚Ä¢ As availability allows, assisting the meal pick up staff with the goal of connecting with students and parents as they come through.

We know students and parents will be excited to see our staff and, as typical in schools, side hugs and high fives are sometimes our custom ‚Äúhellos.‚Äù We are asking parents and students to please greet with voices and smiles as we continue to follow best practices of social distancing during this health emergency.

This plan will be reviewed and modified as the district sees necessary based on guidance and feedback from the Oregon Health Authority, Oregon Department of Education, and Central‚Äôs Nutrition Service Staff.

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

Estimadas familias del Distrito Escolar Central:

Distrito Escolar Central 13J
Respuestas a las preocupaciones de la comunidad
Distribuci√≥n de comidas para estudiantes durante el cierre
Actualizaci√≥n el 14 de marzo del 2020, 3:00pm

Esta es una actualizaci√≥n para compartir informaci√≥n con las familias y la comunidad relacionada con las comidas de los estudiantes durante el cierre. El distrito aprecia el alcance de la comunidad para apoyar este proceso. Sin embargo, tenemos personal incre√≠ble en el Distrito Central entrenados para preparar y entregar comidas para estudiantes durante el cierre. Si necesitamos ayuda adicional, por favor sepa que el distrito se comunicar√° con la comunidad. A continuaci√≥n se muestra informaci√≥n sobre cu√°l ser√° nuestro proceso, generalmente, para la distribuci√≥n de comidas estudiantiles durante el cierre.

Plan de distribuci√≥n de comidas para estudiantes

‚óè El distrito servir√° tanto desayuno como almuerzo en bolsas para llevar. Ambos pueden ser recogidos juntos.
‚óè Se servir√°n las dos comidas por d√≠a a cada ni√±o presente.
‚óè Los ni√±os (de 1 a 18 a√±os) deben estar presentes en el momento de recibir las comidas.
‚óè Las comidas estar√°n disponibles para recoger en cada edificio de 10am a mediod√≠a en los lugares designados para recoger.

Primaria Ash Creek
En frente de Ash creek (en el retorno del cami√≥n)

Primaria de Independence
En la parte norte del edificio en la calle B (las puertas de cafeter√≠a)

Primaria de Monmouth
En frente de Monmouth (en el retorno del cami√≥n)

Secundaria Talmadge
En frente de Talmadge (√°rea de llegar y salir)

Preparatoria Central
En la parte este del edificio por la entrada de el auditorio

El personal del Servicio de Nutrici√≥n har√° comidas para llevar en las cocinas y las colocar√° en refrigeradores. Para reducir cualquier riesgo de contaminaci√≥n, los cocineros de los Servicios de Nutrici√≥n permanecer√°n en la cafeter√≠a y no entregar√°n alimentos directamente al p√∫blico.

‚óè Marcaremos las bolsas con una B (para el desayuno) o L (almuerzo) para diferenciar las dos comidas.
‚óè Estamos teniendo mucho cuidado para asegurarnos de que el personal de entrega y el personal de la cocina est√©n practicando excelente seguridad alimentaria e higiene personal para garantizar la salud de todo el personal, los estudiantes y la comunidad.
‚óè El personal se asegurar√° de dar dos comidas (el desayuno y el almuerzo) para cada ni√±o presente por d√≠a.

Directores/Personal del Distrito

‚óè Como la disponibilidad lo permite, ayudar a el personal que entrega las comidas con el objetivo de conectar con los estudiantes y los padres a medida que llegan a recoger las comidas.

Sabemos que los estudiantes y los padres estar√°n emocionados de ver a nuestro personal y, como es t√≠pico en las escuelas, abrazos secundarios y cinco altos son a veces nuestros "hola" personalizados. Pedimos a los padres y estudiantes que saludan con voces y sonrisas mientras seguimos siguiendo las mejores pr√°cticas de distanciamiento social durante esta emergencia.

Este plan ser√° revisado y modificado seg√∫n el distrito lo vea necesario sobre la base de la orientaci√≥n y comentarios de la Autoridad de Salud de Oreg√≥n, el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oreg√≥n y el Personal del Servicio de Nutrici√≥n de Central.

Gracias por su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este dif√≠cil momento. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad es nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
STUDENT MEALS DURING CLOSURE
UPDATED March 13, 2020, 4:00pm

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPUESTAS A LAS PREOCUPACIONES DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD
COMIDAS PARA LOS ESTUDIANTES DURANTE EL CIERRE
ACTUALIZADO EL 13 DE MARZO DEL 2020, 4:00PM

This is updated information for the community related to student meals during the closure (March 16th ‚Äì March 31st).

All five school sites will have meals throughout the weekdays, beginning March 16th. Meals will be available from 10am to 12pm at all sites. Children under the age of 18 must be present to receive the meals. During this time frame students will receive enough food for breakfast and lunch. All meals will be grab and go. Below are the designated pick up locations at each site:

Ash Creek Elementary
In front of Ash Creek (bus loop)

Independence Elementary
Northside of the building on B street (cafeteria doors)

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
UPDATED MARCH 13, 2020, 9:45 AM.

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPUESTA A LAS PREOCUPACIONES DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD ACTUALIZADO EL 13 DE MARZO DEL 2020, 9:45 AM.

Governor Kate Brown Announces Statewide School Closure for Students in Oregon from Monday, March 16 through Tuesday, March 31

In consideration of staffing challenges and health concerns due to the public health threat of coronavirus, Governor Kate Brown yesterday evening announced a statewide closure of Oregon K-12 schools from Monday, March 16 through Tuesday, March 31.

During this closure all extracurricular activities, sports, and other programming will be suspended.
Central School district will continue to monitor and share updates and information as we receive information from the Governor‚Äôs Office, the Oregon Health Department, and the Oregon Department of Education. Any new information during this time will be communicated to students, families, staff, and community when it is available.

Starting Monday, March 16, and until we reopen schools on April 1, schools will be closed to students and non-essential staff. We know that schools are essential hubs of the community. We know this extended break may cause difficulties for students and families, who rely on their schools for meals, mental health supports and a safe space during the day.

The Central Health and Wellness Center will be open during this time. Hours of operations are as followed:
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday: 8:00am to 5:30pm
Thursday: 8:00am to 4:30pm

Please know that as you enter the Health and Wellness Center you may be asked to put on a mask if you have any type of respiratory symptoms.

This extended time is a preventative measure to help slow the rate of spread of the coronavirus and, as public health agencies explained, flatten the curve of the virus‚Äôs impact on our citizens and health care systems.
Central School District is working on identifying ways to provide meals to student during this break and more information will be shared later today.

We have also built a webpage on the district website with current information. Information will be updated on this site throughout the extended break as necessary. Please visit https://www.central.k12.or.us/ and click on ‚ÄúCSDCOVID19INFO‚Äù at the top of the page or the ‚ÄúCOVID-19 Coronavirus Disease Information‚Äù tab on the left side of the main webpage.

The Central School District Office will remain open during this closure. Thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

Estimadas familias del Distrito escolar central:

La gobernadora Kate Brown anuncia el cierre de las escuelas en todo el estado para estudiantes en Oregon del lunes 16 de marzo al martes 31 de marzo
En consideraci√≥n a los desaf√≠os de personal y las preocupaciones de salud debido a la amenaza de salud p√∫blica del coronavirus, la gobernadora Kate Brown anunci√≥ ayer por la noche un cierre estatal de las escuelas de Oregon K-12 desde el lunes 16 de marzo hasta el martes 31 de marzo.

Durante este cierre, se suspender√°n todas las actividades extracurriculares, deportes y otros programas.

El distrito escolar central continuar√° monitoreando y compartiendo actualizaciones e informaci√≥n a medida que recibamos informaci√≥n de la Oficina de la Gobernadora, el Departamento de Salud de Oregon y el Departamento de Educaci√≥n de Oregon. Cualquier informaci√≥n nueva durante este tiempo se comunicar√° a los estudiantes, las familias, el personal y la comunidad cuando est√© disponible.

A partir del lunes 16 de marzo, y hasta que volvamos a abrir las escuelas el 1 de abril, las escuelas estar√°n cerradas para estudiantes y personal no esencial. Sabemos que las escuelas son centros esenciales de la comunidad. Sabemos que este descanso prolongado puede causar dificultades a los estudiantes y las familias, quienes dependen de sus escuelas para las comidas, los apoyos de salud mental y un espacio seguro durante el d√≠a.

El Centro Central de Salud y Bienestar estar√° abierto durante este tiempo. Las horas de operaciones son las siguientes:
Lunes, martes, mi√©rcoles y viernes: 8:00am a 5:30 pm
Jueves: 8:00am a 4:30 pm

Tenga en cuenta que, al ingresar al Centro de Salud y Bienestar, es posible que se le pida que se ponga una m√°scara si tiene alg√∫n tipo de s√≠ntomas respiratorios.

Este tiempo extendido es una medida preventiva para ayudar a disminuir la tasa de propagaci√≥n del coronavirus y, como explicaron las agencias de salud p√∫blica, aplanar la curva del impacto del virus en nuestros ciudadanos y sistemas de atenci√≥n m√©dica.

El Distrito Escolar Central est√° trabajando para identificar formas de proporcionar comidas a los estudiantes durante este descanso y m√°s informaci√≥n se compartir√° m√°s tarde hoy.

Tambi√©n hemos creado una p√°gina web en el sitio web del distrito con informaci√≥n actualizada. La informaci√≥n se actualizar√° en este sitio durante el descanso extendido seg√∫n sea necesario. Por favor visita https://www.central.k12.or.us/ y haga clic en "CSDCOVID19INFO" en la parte superior de la p√°gina o en la pesta√±a del lado izquierdo de la p√°gina web principal "Informaci√≥n sobre la enfermedad por coronavirus COVID-19" .

La Oficina del Distrito Escolar Central permanecer√° abierta durante este cierre. Gracias por su cooperaci√≥n y comprensi√≥n durante este momento dif√≠cil. La seguridad, la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y nuestra comunidad es nuestra m√°xima prioridad.

post_text:
Dear Central 13J Community: Please review this important information on our response to community health concerns.

CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT 13J
RESPONSE TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CONCERNS
UPDATED March 11, 2020, 11:30pm

The Central School District continue to closely monitor reports relating to the novel coronavirus which causes an infection called COVID-19. There is a lot of information locally, regionally, and nationally and the District relies on its official public health resources to get the most updated and accurate information. This is true of ANY infectious disease such as the flu, the measles or even the common cold.

If there is a report of ANY infectious disease which may be connected to students or staff of the Central School District; Polk County notifies us immediately and provides us with guidance as to how to respond. No notice of this kind has happened.

Tonight, Wednesday, the Governor has issued a statewide ban on gatherings of more than 250 people. That guidance recommends AGAINST closing schools where no cases of COVID-19 are present to protect against losing instructional time.

However, we are following neighboring districts in taking these measures of limiting non-essential school based activities for at least the next 30 days. We are suspending all non-essential school-based activities beginning THURSDAY MARCH 12th. This includes all school-based assemblies, off-campus field trips and professional development meetings. With regard to athletics, we are following new state guidance denying audience admission at all school-based events, with the exception of essential personnel and credentialed media. The list of affected activities will grow as we work with partners and stakeholders over the coming days. We will update you as we make those decisions. Tomorrow we will be reviewing all activities within the school district to identify if further non-essential activities will be cancelled.

We realize that this decision will impact every school community, and we know that many of the events, student performances and other gatherings that we are suspending are those that schools, students and families look forward to all year long. We will be working with trip planners, event organizers and others who are responsible for the affected activities.

In addition to our proactive cleaning and sanitizing measures; we want to increase awareness of proper hand washing by all staff and students (and families!). We encourage everyone to watch a video on proper hand washing technique like this one:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IisgnbMfKvI

OHA officials continue to recommend people in Oregon take everyday precautions to prevent the spread of many respiratory illnesses, including COVID-19 and influenza:
‚Ä¢ Cover your coughs and sneezes with a tissue and then throw the tissue in the trash.
‚Ä¢ Wash your hands often with soap and water for 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
‚Ä¢ Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
‚Ä¢ Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
‚Ä¢ Clean and disinfect surfaces that are often touched.
‚Ä¢ Take care of your health overall. Staying current on your vaccinations, including flu vaccine, eating well and exercising all help your body stay resilient.

The State of Oregon lists the following additional resources. These are available in English and Spanish:
‚Ä¢ For general information, call 211
‚Ä¢ OHA Emerging Respiratory Disease page: www.healthoregon.org/coronavirus
‚Ä¢ CDC COVID-19 page: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
‚Ä¢ CDC travel notice: https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices
‚Ä¢ https://www.oregon.gov/oha

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. We will continue to rely on the guidance from Oregon public health authorities, the Department of Education, and the Office of the Governor. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

OHA officials continue to recommend people in Oregon take everyday precautions to prevent the spread of many respiratory illnesses, including COVID-19 and influenza:
‚Ä¢ Cover your coughs and sneezes with a tissue and then throw the tissue in the trash.
‚Ä¢ Wash your hands often with soap and water for 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
‚Ä¢ Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
‚Ä¢ Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
‚Ä¢ Clean and disinfect surfaces that are often touched.
‚Ä¢ Take care of your health overall. Staying current on your vaccinations, including flu vaccine, eating well and exercising all help your body stay resilient.

The State of Oregon lists the following additional resources. These are available in English and Spanish:
‚Ä¢ For general information, call 211
‚Ä¢ OHA Emerging Respiratory Disease page: www.healthoregon.org/coronavirus
‚Ä¢ CDC COVID-19 page: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
‚Ä¢ CDC travel notice: https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices
‚Ä¢ https://www.oregon.gov/oha

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this difficult time. We will continue to rely on the guidance from Oregon public health authorities, the Department of Education, and the Office of the Governor. The safety, health, and well-being of our students, staff, families, and our community is our highest priority.

post_text:
With your help and support, we were able to fulfill our goal of distributing gifts to over 35 Central School District families this holiday season. We collected over 350 items. Each child received two gifts, and each high school students also received a gift card and a warm blanket. Many students also received a hat, gloves, or a scarf.

We want to thank our Central FFA students who provided a food box for each family, St. Patrick‚Äôs Church who has volunteered to be a gift collection site, and Toys for Tots who help fill gift requests and also serve many of our district families through the MI Toys for Tots project. With the generous donation of a local Eagle Scout, over 160 jackets were also available for our students and families.

Our caring community makes Independence-Monmouth a great place to Learn, Grow, Live, Work, and Lead.

Thank you for your support!

Sincerely,
Jennifer Kubista, Superintendent
Adriana Escobar, Executive Assistant
Juan Jauregui, Program Coordinator - Migrant, Homeless & Foster

Central FFA
December 20, 2019 at 10:31 AM ¬∑

It‚Äôs been a whirlwind as we wrap up 2019 with the annual Food For All project! This year we packed 116,000 POUNDS OF FRESH PRODUCE! This is a record for our school. Thank you all who worked hard, donated your time and your talents to helping those in need.

Today we deliver food to the Elks Lodge and tomorrow we distribute food and toys to families through the Monmouth Independence Christmas Project.

Have a very merry holiday season!
